Ella tienes 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, sus principales siembras son: alverja, habas, olluco y papa, en terrenos alquilados, pues no cuenta con unos propios. “Mi objetivo es ahorrar todo el dinero necesario para comprar mis propios terrenos agrícolas”, comenta. Junto a su esposo, trabaja en la producción de los terrenos para conseguir productos de buena calidad para tener resultados durante todo el año que dura el alquiler. Cuando llega la cosecha vende las habas en la capital del país; pero el maíz y la papa, las vende en la ciudad de su zona, los días domingos. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Pueblo nuevo” y este es su noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente bien trabajando en su banco comunal, ahí recibe consejos para mejorar sus plantaciones, pues todos son agricultores como ella. 
Zenaida invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de papa, además de comida balanceada para los animales que cría.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 32, has lived in a rented house for 13 years with her husband, Héctor, and their three children.  She has ten years’ experience in agriculture.  Her main crops are peas, lima beans, ‘olluco’ (a tuber) and potatoes she grows on leased land because she does not own any land herself.  “My goal is to save all the money necessary to buy my own fields,” she comments.  Together with her husband, she works the land in order to obtain good quality products to get results during the entire year the land lease lasts.  When harvest comes, she sells the lima beans in the national capital but sells the corn and potatoes in her city on Sundays.

She belongs to the “Pueblo Nuevo” (New Town) communal bank and this is her 9th loan with MFP.  She feels good working in her communal bank because she gets advice there to improve her crops because all are farmers like her.  Zenaida will use the requested money to buy several sacks of potato seeds as well as nutritionally balanced feed for the animals she raises.

loans.use: to buy sacks of seeds and animal feed.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Otgontsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband is Ganzorig, who is 46 years old and works as manager of a gas station. In his spare time, he supplements his income by doing construction planning.  Her son Purewdorj is a student and 22 years old. Her daugther Dorjhorol goes to secondary school and is 13 years old. Otgontsetseg works as a bookkeeper at Harganat LLC. Her salary is 250,000 MNT. She is hardworking person and is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to pay her son's college tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her son's college tuition fee.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 45 años, vive junto a Epifanio, su esposo, con quien tiene cuatro hijos.
“Desde niña mis padres me enseñaron a trabajar en la tierra, desde entonces trabajo cuidando los cultivos”, afirma. Desde hace 35 años levantarse muy temprano se convirtió en un hábito, gusta de la agricultura, actividad que le sirve para su sustento económico. Sus principales siembras son: papa, alverja y habas, las que siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que le fueron heredados por sus padres. Su experiencia en la agricultura le sirvió para obtener productos de buena calidad; “fertilizó cada surco con guano de granja natural, por ello obtengo buenos resultados”, afirma.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores Huallhua” y este es su crédito número 9 con MFP. En todo este tiempo ha aprovechado el dinero para mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque se ayudan entre sí.
Justina invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 150 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Justina, 45, lives with Epifanio, her husband; they have four children.  “Since I was a little girl my parents taught me how to work the land.  Since then I work caring for crops,” she affirms.  For the last 35 years rising very early has become her usual habit.  She enjoys agriculture, an activity that provides her with economic support.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and lima beans that she grows in her own fields that were passed down to her from her parents.  Her experience in agriculture was useful for her to obtain good quality products.  “I fertilize each furrow with natural barnyard guano which is why I get good results,” she affirms.

She belongs to the “Productores Huallhua” communal bank and this is MFP loan #9.  In all this time she’s used the money to improve her business which is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  In addition, she enjoys working with her group because they help each other out.  Justina will use the money from this loan to buy 150 sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato crop.

loans.use: to buy 150 sacks of manure.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Señorita Carolina  tiene 21 años y es soltera, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de  vestir tiene su taller de costura en la zona de Alto Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, la Srta. Carolina  va a usar este préstamo  para capital de trabajo (compra de tela por mayor) para su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer el negocio, la Srta.  Carolina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia del mercado y la falta de maquinaria para la confección de prendas de vestir y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando las maquinas que le hacen falta y así de esta manera  incrementar su capital de trabajo, su deseo para su  negocio es tener un taller de costura más grande contratar personal que le ayude a confeccionar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Carolina, 21, is single and works making clothes in her sewing workshop located in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Carolina will use the loan as working capital.  She will buy fabric for her business at wholesale.  The reason for requesting the loan is to make the business grow.  The business challenge Carolina faces in competition in the marketplace and the lack of machinery to make articles of clothing.  She will use profits to continue buying the machines she still needs thus increasing her working capital.  Her wish for her business is to have a larger sewing workshop and to hire personnel to help her make the articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Milton Wilfredo

texts.es: Milton Wilfredo tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su hijo. Desde hace varios años, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y yuca. Esta es la actividad que año con año realiza ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos para subsistir, a acepción de una pequeña remesa familiar que recibe. Es un hombre muy trabajador que con su carisma se ha sabido ganar la confianza de su vecinos y año con año son más las personas que quieren comprar los productos de su cosecha. Este año está listo para comenzar la siembra pero necesita comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como abonos, semillas e insecticidas para lo cual no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para hacerlo por su cuenta. Por tal razón ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar dichos insumos y darle el mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos y así obtener una cosecha abundante para llevar el alimento a su hogar y la  seguridad económica necesaria.
texts.en: Milton Wilfredo is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his son.  He has been growing corn and cassava root for a number of years.  This is the activity that he carries out year after year, because he has no other source of income to live on except for a small family remittance that he receives.  He is a very hardworking man, and with his charisma he has known how to gain the trust of his neighbors so that each year there are more people who want to buy the products from his harvest.  This year he is ready to start planting, but he needs to buy some agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.  He lacks the financial resources to buy these supplies on his own, and so for this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy the supplies so that he can better maintain his crops; in this way he will obtain an abundant harvest, bringing food and economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Khurshidjon

texts.en: Khurshidjon is 31 years old, married and the father of two children. He and his wife are very happy and he is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much. Khurshidjon has been farming his land for the last seven years, producing potatoes and apples, and has worked on farms since he was a boy. In order to help ensure a high-quality crop, he is requesting a loan for 2,400 TJS so that he can buy fertilizers. He awaits your support and assistance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto  tiene 51 años de edad y habita junto a su esposa y tres hijos. El se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Junto a sus hijos siembra variedad de cultivos como: maíz, y repollos. Siempre busca la forma de sacarle provecho a sus tierras ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Espera que este año los frutos de su esfuerzo sean positivos ya que la temporada para la siembra ya dio inicio y desea  obtener una cosecha abundante para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Todo lo anterior lo han impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que desea invertir en abonos e insecticidas para los  cultivos ya que son indispensables para el buen desarrollo. Asegura poder pagar dicha deuda una vez sacada la cosecha así como lo ha hecho en el pasado, vale la pena  mencionar que cuenta con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en: Gilberto, 51, lives with his wife and three children.  He’s been working in agriculture for many years.  Alongside his children he plants crops like corn and cabbage.  He’s always looking for ways to make his land productive since it’s his only source of income.  He earns his livelihood and provides sustenance for his home this way.  He hopes the fruits of his labor will be positive this year since the planting season has started already and he wants to obtain an abundant harvest to meet his family’s needs.  All the above has pushed him to request this loan from INTEGRAL because he wants to buy manure and insecticide that is indispensable for his crops’ proper development.  He is sure he will be able to repay the loan once his harvest is in like he’s done in the past.   It’s worth mentioning that he has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
Pedro Ángel de 51 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y un hijo puesto que sus otros dos hijos ya hicieron hogar.  Su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar. El señor Pedro se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 10 años. Es muy conocido como un buen agricultor el cual se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable y honrado.  Cada año cultiva la tierra con variedad de granos y hortalizas, es un hombre creativo el cual saca provecho a la tierra que posee. Este año quiere invertir en los insumos para el cultivo de maíz ya que sin ellos la milpa no se desarrolla como tal y no hay probabilidades de tener una cosecha abundante. 

La agricultura es la principal fuente de ingresos para el señor Pedro al igual que para todo campesino, es por ello que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos agrícolas que le permitan a sus cultivos desarrollarse de la mejor manera para obtener una cosecha abundante. Confía en Dios que obtendrá resultados positivos que le permitirán continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y brindar seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Ángel, 51, lives in a house of his own with his wife and son since his other two children have already formed their own homes.  His wife is a housewife in charge of domestic chores at home.  Pedro has been working in agriculture for more than 10 years.  He’s very well-known for being a good farmer noted for being hardworking, responsible and honest.  Every year he grows vegetables and grains.  He’s very creative in his use of his land and obtains good results from it.  This year he wants to buy supplies for corn crops because without them the corn plants will not develop properly making an abundant harvest impossible.

Agriculture is Pedro’s main source of income, like all farmers.  This is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy farm supplies that will make it possible for his crops to develop in the best way possible in order to obtain an abundant harvest.  He trusts in God that he’ll get positive results that will allow him to continue providing daily bread for his home and economic security for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years old and has been engaged in a clothes-selling business for eight years. Due to her diligence, she successfully provides a good source of income. She is aiming for high income that would improve their living conditions. This prompted her to borrow a loan amount of KES 40,000 to buy goods such as shirts, dresses, pants and skirts. She wants to grow her business so that she can afford to send her two children to school until they finish.

She wishes to uplift her family from deficiency, thus she is working so hard to provide for the needs of her children, especially their educational needs. She hopes, with the help of this loan amount, she will reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future.

loans.use: to buy goods such as shirts, dresses, pants and skirts.

loans.name: Naimanchuluun

texts.en: Naimanchuluun is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in the Arahangai Province of Mongolia. His wife Tungalag is 31 years old and is a teacher in a kindergarden.   His  two sons are six and three years old and they go to kindergarden. He started his taxi service business in 2002. He is well experienced and popular in town. He is asking for 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughrik) to purchase a spare part for his car.

loans.use: To purchase a spare part for his car

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married and has two adult children. She lives in Kosovo but her husband currently lives in Germany. She recently moved into new house in a small village. She and her family had lived in a small house before the move, but there life was very difficult for all of them both financially and emotionally. Violeta’s brother helped them build their new home. 

Violeta makes a living by raising cows, which is the main source of income for her family. She started this business by selling milk in her neighborhood. “I am very pleased with this business because I have my reduced family’s costs while increasing our income,” said Violeta. Proudly she claims that she has been the only one who has financially supported her family.

Now that her life has been greatly improved, she is requesting a loan to buy cow and calf. This is Violeta's first loan. She wants to expand her business and save for her youngest child’s university expenses. She is aware that without Kiva lenders, her goal will be difficult to achieve. Violeta is very appreciative for the help.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf.

loans.name: José Isidro

texts.es: José Isidro habita en su casa junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde hace muchos años. Algunas veces también realiza trabajos de corta de café, ya que él es un hombre trabajador y busca cualquier forma honrada para inyectar efectivo a su economía. Su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura al igual que para todo campesino. Cada año cultiva la tierra y después de sacar la cosecha pone  a la venta una parte de la misma. De esta forma es como logra sostener económicamente a su familia ya que él  es único que aporta a la economía del hogar.  Vale la pena mencionar que la agricultura no es un negocio de todo el tiempo, las cosechas de maíz y frijoles es por temporada y solo se da una vez al año. Esto hace que todo campesino se esfuerce lo más que puede para sacar una cosecha abundante. El señor José es uno de ellos, debido a que la temporada para la siembra ya comenzó, ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en abono, insecticidas y semillas ya que no puede hacer el desembolso por sus propios medios. Es un hombre con experiencia crediticia el cual está muy agradecido con esta institución por la ayuda que anteriormente le brindaron.
texts.en: José Isidro lives in his house with his family unit composed of his spouse and children.  He’s worked growing corn and beans for many years.  Sometimes he also works harvesting coffee since he’s a hardworking man who looks for any honest way to earn income.  His main source of income is agriculture like all farmers.  He cultivates the land every year and after taking in his harvest sells part of it.  In this way he’s able to support his family economically since he’s the only one who contributes economically to the home.  It’s worth mentioning that agriculture isn’t a full-time job.  Corn and bean crops are seasonal and are only harvested once a year.  This causes all farmers to strive the most they can to produce abundant harvests.  José is one of them and because the planting season has begun already he’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy manure, insecticide and seeds because he does not have means of his own to do so.  He is a man with credit experience and is very grateful to this institution for the help they provided him previously.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang is a 35-year-old married woman who has been living in the Baray region of Cambodia, where she operates a farming business. She grows rice and vegetables for sale on farmland she inherited while her husband runs a recycling business and is the family's main breadwinner. Kheang has been in her current line of work for more than 10 years and uses her income to pay for her family’s sustenance, give allowances to her children, and meet other daily expenses.

Kheang is experiencing financial difficulties in her farming business. That's why she is seeking for a loan for 600,000 KHR to pay for the labor costs she incurs when planting rice and to purchase fertilizer for her crops. She believes that the loan will have a positive impact on her business, and thanks all generous Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs incurred in planting rice and to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco Antonio de 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y  seis  hijos, formando una familia muy unida y trabajadora quienes se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Francisco ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cultivo de frijoles y maíz, la cual es una de las actividades más usuales en la zona rural del país. Francisco junto a toda su familia se dedican a realizar este trabajo en una parcela que él alquila para realizar este trabajo. Francisco solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de maíz y frijoles para poder hacer crecer la siembra de su parcela y poder cosechar más granos básicos. Con el aumento de las ventas Francisco tiene la esperanza que podrá contar con una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Antonio is 36 years old and lives with his wife and six children. They are a very united and hardworking family who make a great deal of effort to get ahead.  Francisco has dedicated a large part of his life to growing corn and beans, which is a one of the most common economic activities in the rural areas of the country.  With his family, he works a parcel of land that he rents so that he can grow his crops.

He is seeking a loan so that he will be able to buy a greater quantity of corn and beans and thus obtain a larger harvest of these crops.  With increased sales, he hopes to be able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and beans for planting.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 38, is a hardworking, dedicated woman who very much wants to get ahead. She has lived together for many years with the man who has been her companion since her adolescence and with whom she has five children, all in school. They all live together in a humble house she built with her spouse as a result of their efforts at work.

She operates a vegetable stall. She places her order every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday with suppliers she works with and where she is supplied with fresh fruits and vegetables. She’s been in this business for about eight years and does very well since she earns good profits from her sales. She plans later on to own a kiosk.

This is her second loan from Yehu. She is grateful for the trust placed in her in order to access this loan and be able to continue towards her goals. She commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the requested loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alice Ncha

texts.en: Alice is happily married and blessed with six children. She lives with her family in a six-bedroom house located in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has encountered many challenges in her life, including a lack of adequate capital to start up a business, a low income which has made it difficult to provide for even basic needs, the theft of some of her farm animals, and the death of some members of her family. But joining GHAPE in 2010 allowed her see some light on the horizon because she now has access to cheap and affordable business and financial services, good loan repayment terms, and training on life skills and on  business/marketing techniques. She is applying for a loan to buy more crates of chicks and pigs, and feed for them to eat. She will also use the loan to buy flour, vegetable oil and firewood. This loan will allow her to improve her family's life as well as her business and her community, and build a place to store firewood so that it does not get wet when it is raining.

loans.use: to buy farm animals, firewood, flour and oil.

loans.name: Onditi

texts.en: Onditi is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her five children in Coast Province, Kenya. She has been selling foodstuffs such as fried potatoes, dumplings, etc. at the market. She also sells fish and juice. She has been in this business for more than five years, earning approximately Ksh 500 daily. Her husband is a businessman. All of her children are in school. Onditi is requesting a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, cooking oil, and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Shijirtseteg

texts.en:
Shijirtseteg is 41 years old, and lives with her three children in Tosontsengel, Zavhan, Mongolia. Her younger son goes to a secondary school and her daughter goes to college. The older son is working in Ulaanbaatar. 

In 2000, Shijirtseteg started a family business, which produces Mongolian national shoes and other clothes. She is a widowed woman . Her business supports the family. Her average profit is 200,000-400,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughrik) per month. She needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials such as 50 meters of silk, fabric and rawhide for boots.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as 50 meters of silk, fabric and rawhide for boots

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Fernando Antonio de 50 años de edad,  vive junto a su esposa e hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, él es una persona muy humilde y emprendedora quien trabaja muy arduamente día con día. Fernando posee una parcela en la que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, la cual posteriormente comercializa en diferentes departamentos del país, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias. Él desea aumentar su cosecha razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar pesticidas, abono, arados y semillas de frijol y maíz de la mejor calidad para sembrar y así obtener una excelente cosecha. El deseo de Fernando  es mejorar en gran manera  su negocio, garantizando la calidad de su semilla y así satisfacer siempre a sus clientes y así mismo obtener otros nuevos, lo que le permita mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando Antonio is 50 years old, and he lives with his wife and children, who are 12 and 15 years of age.  He is a very humble and resourceful person who works very hard day after day.  He has a parcel of land on which he grows corn and beans, which he then sells in different districts of the country, obtaining very good profits.

He is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL because wants to increase the size of his harvests.  The loan will enable him to buy pesticide, fertilizer and ploughshares, as well as seed corn and beans of better quality in order to obtain an excellent harvest.  He wishes to make substantial improvements to his business, thus guaranteeing the quality of his crops and always being able to satisfy his customers and attract new customers.  This will in turn lead to increased financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn for planting.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a very hard worker who is 100% dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and their seven children. She has more than two years experience running her preparatory school. In addition, Mariam owns a motorcycle where she has hired an employee to operate it and also makes juice from her home.

Mariam will invest this loan in the purchase of tables and chairs and a refrigerator. With this loan she hopes to improve her sales and better satisfy the necessities of her customers. She also hopes to have a higher income to improve her quality of life. Her dream is to be able to improve her businesses by making them grow so that they become more profitable and this way she will be able to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a widow and has six children, with three below the age of 15. The entire family lives in a four room apartment house in Nkwen, Cameroon.

Life has not been easy with her as following the death of her husband, her junior sister followed suit. She also suffered a great loss when her vegetable farm went bad due to late harvesting. Thieves also broke into her house and got away with a lot of things. Due to the lack of proper education Beatrice's children have also had bad results in official exams. Nonetheless light was on the horizon when she joined GHAPE.

She will be using this loan amount to increase her business with items that she is buying: more bags of wheat, flour, fuel, wood, 20 liters of vegetable oil, more trays of eggs and a bag of salt. This is going to assist the ever increasing urban population with fast food. Her longetivity in the business is a strength for the success of the business.  As is the high demand of fast food, especially during breaks. The profits of her business will assit her in paying her children's school fees, provide better healthcare, and give her a general increase in standards of living. While the rest will be ploughed back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, flour,fuel, wood and vegetables

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 32-year-old woman and mother of two sons and two daughters, living in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a very hard working and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband to provide for the family needs and her children’s education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past eight years and her clients always appreciate her work. Kalsoom has requested a loan to purchase a sewing machine for the expansion of her business. She is hopeful the loan will contribute to her business success.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Héctor Eduardo

texts.es: Héctor Eduardo de 41 años de edad,  vive junto a su esposa y un hijo menor de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar,  él es una persona muy trabajadora quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y amigos, ya que es muy responsable y dedicado a su familia. Héctor se dedica al cultivo de  maicillo y maíz, los cuales comercializa por mayoreo, Este trabajo representa la única fuente de ingresos para él y su familia, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el cual pueda invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima para la siembra de cereales y así producir mayor cantidad, con lo que podrá mejorar de forma significativa sus ventas, el trabajo  de Héctor  es muy duro pero lo desempeña de la mejor manera para poder vender los granos a muy buenos precios, por lo que desea poder aprovechar al máximo la temporada de inicio de siembra comprando semilla de excelente calidad en cantidades mayores y de esta forma  sembrar más y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Héctor Eduardo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and his young son, who is in school.  He is a very hardworking person who has very good references from this friends and neighbors.  He is very responsible and dedicated to his family.  He grows sorghum and corn, which he sells wholesale.

This work represents to only source of income for him and his family.  He is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy a larger quantity of seeds so that he can obtain a larger harvest.  This will allow him to increase his sales significantly.

Hector's work is very hard, but he makes every possible effort to be able to sell his crops at very good prices.   He wishes to take full advantage of the upcoming planting season and buy seeds of excellent quality in large quantities, and thus be able to sell more and obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron is 38 years old and married with five single children, two of whom work and help Ron financially. She has been operating a general store at home from which she sells various products. She typically generates an income of approximately 4.00 USD per day. Ron’s husband shares the responsibility for the family by working as a paid laborer on a rubber tree plantation. 

Ron would like to increase her stock of merchandise to satisfy her customers. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 USD to purchase canned items, noodles, candy, snacks, cigarettes, beverages, personal care products and other miscellaneous household products. She hopes to have more customers and increase her revenue as a result of these purchases. This will be her fifth loan with HKL and she is an honest client.

loans.use: to purchase canned items, noodles, candy, snacks, cigarettes, beverages, personal care products and other miscellaneous household products.

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es: La Sra. Leandra tiene 62 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 25 y 19 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de verdura que se encuentran en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de la Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Leandra va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción  para refacción de los ambientes de su domicilio para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar ambientes domicilio, la Sra. Leandra enfrenta retos en su negocio que son estabilidad de puesto de venta y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar ambiente de vida en su domicilio, su deseo  es la compra de vehículo propio que le ayude a transportar su mercadería.
texts.en: Leandra, 62, is married and has two children who are 25 and 19 years old. She sells vegetables on a very busy street in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first with the institution. She will use the loan to buy construction materials to repair her house for her business. Leandra faces some business challenges, such as stability for her business location. She will use the proceeds to improve her house. She wishes to buy her own car to help transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to refurbish her home.

loans.name: María Erlinda

texts.es: María Erlinda tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella trabaja muy duro junto a su esposo para sacar  adelante a su familia. Ella y su esposo se dedican al cultivo de hortalizas y maíz desde hace muchos años.  Gracias a su carisma se han sabido ganar la confianza de sus vecinos los cuales expresan estar muy satisfechos con los productos que ofrece de sus cultivos. Siembra  variedad de hortalizas lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y comercializar una parte de la misma. La señora María es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy dedicada a sus labores. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su querida familia esto la motiva a trabajar con mas esmero ya que para ella su familia lo es todo y es su mejor tesoro. Solicita este préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, semillas, insecticidas, etc. Que le permitan mejorar sus cultivos y tener acceso a una cosecha abundante para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor cantidad de hortalizas, con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos que le permitan lograr su sueño.
texts.en: María Erlinda is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in a house she owns. Along with her husband, she works very hard in order to get her family ahead. She and her husband have been cultivating vegetables and corn for many years. Thanks to their charisma, they have been able to gain the trust of their neighbors, who express that they are very satisfied with the produce they offer from their crops. She grows a variety of vegetables, which allow her to support her household and sell part of the crop. María is a hardworking and responsible woman who's very dedicated to her work. Her dream is to improve her beloved family's living conditions. This motivates her to work harder, since her family is everything to her and it's her greatest treasure. She requests this loan from INTEGRAL so she can invest it in the purchase of farming supplies such as compost, seeds, insecticide, etc. This will allow her to improve her crop and get a bountiful harvest, so that she can offer her customers a larger quantity of vegetables. Her aim is to increase her profits, which will allow her to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam is 41 years old and married to a lovely woman; they have 4 children. He is very hardworking and clever. Uktam has been farming for 10 years, producing potatoes and wheat; his products are sold at the local market in the city. He earns additional income from animal husbandry. 

In order to properly attend to his crops, Uktam is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 TJS to buy fertilizer. The fertilizer will allow him to continue improving his crops and vegetable production. He hopes to generate more income and take advantage of high sales prices to maintain a better standard of living and help his children continue their education.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 47 años de edad vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así también  junto a sus  hijos. Desde hace muchos  años  que Francisco se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, los cuales también vende en diferentes lugares de la zona en que reside. El trabajo lo realiza únicamente junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos mayores, lo que no le impide a Francisco realizarlo ya que es más grande su deseo por salir adelante y brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia. El solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de frijoles y maíz para sembrar y aumentar la cantidad de  granos que produce.
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old and lives with his wife, who does the house chores with their children. 

For many years, Francisco has been cultivating grains, which he also sells in different places in the area where he lives. He works with his wife and one of his older children, who help with what Francisco can't do. He has a big desire to get ahead and provide everything for his family.

He is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL, through which he could obtain the necessary money to invest in the purchase of beans and corn for sowing. That will increase the quantity of grains he produces.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds to sow

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel se dedica al oficio de la agricultura desde hace  10 años, este es un trabajo que aprendió de su familia, ya que se han dedicado a esto durante generaciones  y gracias al cual ha logrado salir adelante hasta ahora. Miguel reside en una zona rural donde la agricultura es la principal actividad económica y vive junto a su esposa e hijos. él siembra frijoles y maíz, dos de los granos más vendidos en este país por ser parte de la dieta principal. Este es el negocio que le permite sostener a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de frijoles y maíz para sembrar, con esto Miguel espera sembrar muchas más semillas y poder percibir más ganancias que años anteriores, así también desea comprar abono y otros suministros básicos para el cultivo, lo que le permita mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel has been earning his living from agriculture for over 10 years. He learnt about this type of work from his family which has been working this way for generations and thanks to which he has been able to keep moving forward.

Miguel lives in a rural zone where agriculture is the principal economic activity. He lives with his wife and children. He sows beans and corn, two of the most commonly sold grains in this country as they form part of the average diet. 

This business allows him to support his family. For this reason he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan, with the hope of obtaining the money necessary to buy beans and corn in bulk. 

With this Miguel hopes to sow many more seeds and obtain a larger income than previously. He also hopes to buy manure and other basic supplies for the crops, which will help him to improve his harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Khurshid

texts.en:
Khurshid is a 47-year-old married woman and has been operating her general store for the past 8 months. She is happy to have this work in order to lead a respectable life. 

Khurshid is a responsible mother of three daughters and two sons and is committed to fulfilling their needs. Her husband works as a driver and one of her sons is employed in a workshop but their income is not enough to support her family. She strives to achieve her goals in order to support her family well.  Her business has gradually improved with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is requesting a loan for Rs 30,000 to buy additional items for her general store which will help her sustain this business.

loans.use: to buy more items for her general store.

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en:
Sanjar is single and 18 years old. He is a person who always tries to help to people in need. With the goal of providing his family with a high quality of living, four years ago Sanjar began an animal husbandry business. He is now one of the best and most successful businessmen in the local market. He buys cows, cares for them for 2 to 3 months and then sells them to local people. Thanks to his hard work, his cows are fat and attract a lot of customers. He earns additional income by growing potatoes. 

Sanjar wants to buy more cows to develop his business but does not have sufficient funds. He is asking for a loan of 4500 TJS to buy cows. He continues to work towards providing his family with a high quality of living and awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Juana Fidelia

texts.es: Juana Fidelina de 56 años de edad, con 6 hijos mayores de edad, viuda, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería y venta de cosméticos la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, experiencia que tiene en el negocio 10 años, la cual inicio como una necesidad para sobrevivir y tener un medio de subsistencia, con el financiamiento comprara productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, jabón, pan, queso, tiste, posos, chicha, cebada, frutas, verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana Fidelina is 56 years old, widowed, and has six grown children. She manages a store in order to earn a living and also sells cosmetics from her home. Juana has 10 years of experience in running her businesses. She started her businesses out of necessity in order to survive and have a means of supporting herself.

With this loan she will buy everyday consumer products such as rice, sugar, soap, bread, cheese, “tiste” (a traditional Nicaraguan beverage made from corn and cacao), coffee grounds, “chicha” (another traditional beverage made from corn), barley, fruit, vegetables, and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jorge Amadeo

texts.es: Jorge Amadeo habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y nieto. El se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz y frijoles. Desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar la tierra y en la actualidad es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. No cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos más que la agricultura. Cada año se prepara para la nueva cosecha la cual siempre espera que sea abundante.  El señor Jorge es un hombre que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, honesto y responsable. Tiene mucha experiencia en la agricultura lo cual le ha permitido ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada año esperan sus cosechas ya que lo prefieren por la calidad  de sus productos y los buenos precios que ofrece.  Es una persona muy sencilla y humilde que con muchos esfuerzos lleva el sustento a su hogar. Como todo hombre emprendedor ha tomado la decisión de presentarse a esta institución, INTEGRAL, para solicitar este crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos (abonos, insecticidas, etc.) necesarios para el buen desarrollo de los  cultivos. Confía en Dios que con su trabajo logrará lo que se propone y una vez obtenga la cosecha podrá cancelar la deuda y continuar dando sostenibilidad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Jorge Amadeo lives in his own home with his son and grandson. He is engaged mainly in agriculture, growing corn and beans.

He learned to farm since very young and now that's what allows him to earn the daily bread for his household. He doesn't have any other sources of income other than agriculture. 

Every year, he gets ready for the new harvest, always hoping it to be abundant. Jorge is a man who is known for being hard working, honest, and responsible. He has a lot of experience in agriculture, what allows him to gain the trust of many customers who every year wait for his crops. They prefer them for the quality of his products and the good prices he offers.   

He is very simple and modest, bringing the food to his home with great effort. Like other entrepreneurs, he took the decision to apply to this institution, INTEGRAL, to request a loan to invest in supplies (fertilizers, insecticides, etc.), necessary for the crops. He trusts in God that he will achieve what he aims with his work. Once he obtains the crops, he will be able to cancel the debt and continue providing economic sustainability to his home.

loans.use: to buy: fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Kisa Kya Mukama Wamala Group

texts.en:
The Kisa Kya Mukama group is located in rural Entebbe and is mostly comprised of agriculturalists. After hearing an advertisement on the radio, group members were interested in loans to improve their agriculture production. Members knew they could not meet their goals independently and chose to form a group.

Patrick, a group member, is a farmer who grows crops such as plantain, potatoes, and beans. He also rears pigs, which are in high demand because pork is a major delicacy in the city. Patrick is a subsistence farmer who sells his surplus and his main business challenge is harsh weather. 

Patrick is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan to pay school fees for his children. He will also use a portion of his loan to buy pigs. In the future, he hopes to build a house for his family and buy some rentals if possible.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena  tiene 39 años y tiene  5 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de carne, ella tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Santa cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elena va a usar este préstamo para inversión comprando un frízer grande para su negocio su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de abastecer a su clientela, la Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. Elena es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito, su deseo es poder ver un día a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Elena is 39 years old and has five children. She makes a living selling a variety of meats. She has a stand in one of the most popular markets in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is her first cycle within the institution. Elena is going to use this loan to invest in the purchase of a large freezer for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is the need to stock up for her customers. 

Elena faces some challenges in her business including increasing her clientele. She is going to use her profits to improve her family's standard of living. Elena is a very hard working person and is happy for the opportunity provided with the provision of the loan. Her wish is to be able to see her children become working professionals one day.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is 40 years old. She lives in a small village in the Sagarejo District with her husband Noe and 22-year-old son. Her son has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Neli works as a sick nurse and gets a monthly salary. Neli and Noe own a vineyard. They work hard on their vineyard during the spring and summer seasons. They pick grapes in late summer and sell them to local farmers. Noe also helps local farmers in agricultural work using his own horse and gets a service fee for the work. Along with the above mentioned activities, Neli is busy with trading. She sells clothes in her village. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Neli requested credit for purchasing seasonal clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of clothes to the customers and increase her sales, and, consequently, her profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 27 years old and married to a man who is working as a security guard. She has two children, and she is requesting a loan to buy additional items including coffee, sugar and rice to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2003 with working capital of $50.00. She is living in a house made of zinc and palm branches for its roof. She wants to build a good house and live a good life in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items including coffee, sugar and rice to improve her business

loans.name: Roseline Mbain

texts.en:
She is married and happily blessed with three children and the entire family lives in a two-room house at New Lay Out, Nkwen, Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon.

Mama has been through some difficulties in her life, such as the death of her two brothers who were of great help to her. She again lost her mother's support due to an accident the mother had. Her daughter was raped and it has been a very traumatizing tale within her family. Lack of proper education and the healthcare needs of her family members are also issues, as is the lack of her adequate capital to start up a business and low incomes within the family. However this situation is being relieved with the joining of GHAPE which has been of great help to their family due to their social and basic life skills trainings.

This loan will be used for the purchase of bananas and fuel wood for retail within the community. This will help the community in the provision of fruits that is bananas thereby adding to their nutritional needs. The fuel wood is greatly going to assist the women who go for long distances in search of fuel wood, hence reducing the distance to the market or for its search. This business venture will succeed because of the high demand for fuel wood within the community. The profits of this loan will be used to provide proper education and healthcare for her family. She will also use it to renovate her house. And the rest of it will be put back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase fuel wood and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a pen and purchase nourishment for her animals.

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr:
Alioune est couturier depuis 5 ans. Il possède en même temps une boutique de produits cosmétiques qui se situe en face de son atelier. Dans la boutique, elle vend  du lait pour le corps, du parfum, du champoing…
Alioune sollicite un crédit de 150000Fcfa afin d’acheter des mèches, des greffages, des parfums et de renouveler le stock manquant. Alioune est célibataire, âgé de 28 ans, il vit chez ses parents et c’est lui qui les entretient.
Comme projet futur, il désire élargir son espace  de vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Alioune has been a fashion designer for 5 years. He also has a cosmetics boutique which is located opposite his studio. In his boutique he sells body lotion, perfume, shampoos...

Alioune is asking for a loan of 150000 Fcfa in order to buy highlighting and hair transplant supplies, perfume, and to replenish his inventory. Alioune is single, is 28 years old, and lives at his parents' home where he takes care of them.

As a future project, he would like to have a larger space in which to sell his cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 37-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of six children, four daughter and two sons. She enjoys her business weaving rugs and shawls and, with the support of Kashf Foundation, she has built a successful business. Shamim has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving and her daughters help in her work making rugs and shawls. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence.

Shamim is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy raw materials such as wool, threads, cutters, and tools to expand her business. Her loan will help her attain a better life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wool, thread, and cutters to make rugs

loans.name: Florence Bih

texts.en:
She is a single mother with three children with one of them below the age of 15 years. She lives with her family in a three-room apartment at Ntarikon quarters of Bamenda, North west region of Cameroon.

It's been a difficult time with her as she has faced lots of problems like the death of her son, a difficult marital life leading to her divorce, lack of capital to do some business, poverty within the family cycle and the poor health of her family members. She intends to use this money to buy and sell food stuff like groundnuts, cocoyams, maize, cassava, bananas, plantains, egusi and eru. She believes that her business venture will succeed because of her longevity in the business and the high demand for these products in the community. The community will benefit from the supply of foodstuff at short notice.

The profits will help her in improving the housing conditions of the family, providing better education and healthcare for the family and expanding her business. She has been a member of GHAPE since 2010 and prefers their money because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, groundnuts, maize and bananas

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 34 years old, is a friendly woman who is entrepreneurial and very social. She is married to a driver. They live in a rental house which has both electricity and piped water. Joyce owns a juice parlor business. She began with the help of one of her husbands who offered her working capital. She has learned a lot from her life experiences and is loved by her customers who say she is always smiling and always has encouraging words for them. Her dream is to open a hair dressing college in the future.

Joyce is taking out a loan to open a salon. She promises to continue making payments punctually and responsibly. She is happy to belong to Yehu because she knows that the staff are responsible and supportive.

loans.use: to open a salon.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Following the footsteps of his brothers and sister, Ashraf wants to get his bachelor's degree without adding more expenses to his parents. Ashraf wishes to get another loan so he can pay for his own expenses and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 37 years old and is married with two sons, 11 and 13 years old, both of whom go to school. She lives in the Sighnaghi district in a small village with her family that also includes her in-laws. Irma and her husband Gocha run the family agricultural business. They own a vineyard and a plot of land where they grow various vegetables such as tomato, pepper, and eggplant. They work hard on their land during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. Irma and Gocha are busy with livestock as well, rearing cattle to sell at a profit. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 GEL.

Irma is requesting a loan to purchase additional calves to raise and sell later for a profit. Irma will reinvest her additional earnings to expand her agricultural enterprise to make it more profitable and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase calves to rear and sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a dynamic single woman with three children, one of whom is younger than 15. She lives in the Mile 90, Bamenda, northwest region of Cameroon. She and her family live in a three-room apartment. Lilian works making dresses. She has faced many challenges in her life such as the lack of financing to start her business and a low income which makes it difficult to take care of basic needs. Lilian dropped out of school due to the lack of school fees and her mother's death further compounded the situation. She joined GHAPE in 2006 and has seen a light in the horizon due to resources such as cheap and affordable business financing, long loan repayment durations, and life skills and business and marketing training. 

Lilian is requesting a loan to buy thread and cloth to use in her dressmaking workshop. She will also use part of her loan to pay for farm labor and buy seedlings, manure, and fertilizer. Lilian thinks that her dress making business will succeed because of her longevity as a seamstress and high demand. Her business will help the community because dresses will be available at cheap prices. There will also be more food items on her farm. Lilian will use the profit from her loan to provide medical care for her family, pay school fees, and expand her dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth to use in her dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk is 58 years old and has three school-aged children who currently attend local schools. He is a government officer who works in the ministry of tourism of Cambodia located in KamponTom province. Ouk has been in this occupation for many years and earns a decent salary to support his family. He is very happy because his wife helps him with the household income by operating a grocery store and serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner to local people. Ouk and his wife agreed to educate their children up to a university degree and they try hard to support their basic needs.

Ouk is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase a motorcycle to serve as a transportation service for his children as their high schools are far away from home. His loan will support his children in their education so they can earn degrees in the future and have better jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle​ so his children can commute to school

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 38 years old, is married and has 4 children whose ages range from 1 to 14 years. She describes herself as jovial and warm. Hannah operates a poultry business and eight Posho mills, selling maize flour and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 10 staff members with the help of her husband. Her business is located near the main road of Rongai and her primary customers are surrounding residents. Hannah describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of maize for grinding into flour.

Hannah will use this KES 32,700 loan to purchase a water tank that she will use for household chores and poultry. Her business goal is to build rental houses within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be faithful woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells sacks of charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area and her primary customers are esteemed business people. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of charcoal for resell. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a water tank. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business. Previously, Susan had been selling clothes which she decided to stop doing and started engaging herself in her current charcoal selling activity. She had taken a loan of Kes 20,000 which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha, 28 years old, is married and has a daughter who is 4 years old. She describes herself as warm and friendly. For the past 3 years, Tabitha has operated a farm and a poultry business where she sells eggs, milk, vegetables such as kale, pumpkins and paw paw (papaya). Her business is located on a main road in Rongai and her primary customers are surrounding residents and shops at the market. Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficients funds.

Tabitha will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank to catch rain water which can be used on the farm and for her chickens and cow. Her goal is to improve her business whereby the profit can be used to revive her matatu (bus) business within 5 years. Tabitha hopes that, in the future, she will have many businesses and her family will prosper. Tabitha also runs a beauty salon. She has three sisters who help with the farm, poultry and other businesses. Her whole family will benefit from the water tank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rorbert

texts.en:
Rorbert, 28 years old, is married and blessed with three children. For the past year, he has run a motorbike transport business, popularly known as boda boda, in Kabarnet, earning an average monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Rorbert has borrowed a second loan of KES 50,000, having successfully repaid his previous loan. He intends to use this loan to purchase a new motorbike after disposing of the one he currently operates. Rorbert anticipates getting profits which he will use to expand the business by purchasing more motorbikes and employing riders to assist him.

Rorbert hopes to improve his living standards, to save money to enable him to pay his children's school fees and to start another business for his spouse.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Maoda Malick

texts.fr:
Mawdo Malick est un jeune de 22 ans qui est célibataire sans enfant. Il est mécanicien de profession ou il a acquis une expérience de 5 ans. Il a ouvert une place au marché de son quartier et vend des pièces détachées. C’est la raison pour laquelle il demande un crédit de 30000Fcfa qui est d’ailleurs son 1er prêt à l’IMCEC.
Il a comme charge sa maman, avec qui il vit. Il désire dans l’avenir agrandir son commerce en augmentant la capacité des produits et pièces détachées qu’il vend.
texts.en:
Mawdo Malick is a 22-year old man, single without children. He is a car mechanic by trade and has five years of experience. He has opened a stand at the local market where he sells spare parts. This is why he is requesting a loan of 30,000 West African francs, which is his first loan with IMCEC.
He supports his mother, who lives with him. In the future, he would like to expand his business by expanding the volume of products and spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 67 años, y tiene la alegría y el espíritu de una joven de 20 años; con esfuerzo ha criado y sacado adelante sola a sus 4 hijos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica,  ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo otro de sus atractivos turísticos es la famosa “bruja de Cachiche”, la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año.  Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello su platillo favorito es el riquísimo “Tallarín con papa a la Huancaína”; debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser profesora.

Rosa se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio de venta de abarrotes, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque vende productos de buena calidad y trata muy bien a los clientes y sobre todo a un buen precio.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que le han brindado su apoyo por segunda vez y gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una balanza electrónica, comprar repisas y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, con lo cual podrá dar una mejor atención a su clientes y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día a día para poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener tienda Comercial”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old and has the happiness and spirit of a young woman of 20 years of age. With effort she has raised and brought her children forward by herself. Her home is located in the city of Ica. The city is characterized for having one of the most attractive tourist sites in the country, the "Laguna de Huacachina". Another one of its attractive tourist sites is the famous "Bruja de Cachiche" which is visited by an infinite number of tourists during anytime of the year. Like a good Peruvian she likes the typical food of the country and her favorite dish is the delicious "Tallarin con papa a la Huancaina". Due to her parents' limited economic resources she only went up to secondary school but would have liked to study to become a teacher. 

Rosa gets up very early to open her grocery store. She dedicates about 10 hours to her store and can attend to up to 30 customers during the day. She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she sells good quality products and treats her customers very well. Above all everything is at a good price. 

Rosa is very thankful for the Kiva lenders that are now bringing her support for the second time. Thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy an electronic scale, shelves and goods such as rice, sugar and noodles, among other items. With these she will be able to give her customers better service and improve her earnings and standard of living. This will allow her to continue fighting each day to fulfill her greatest dream: to have her own larger store.

loans.use: to buy a scale, display cases and merchandise.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en:
Ms. Raqia is a 33-year-old married woman who's been selling milk for the past 20 years. She has five calves and two milk cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has two daughters who are going to school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life including good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s Ms. Raqia's second year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with its support. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase her production capacity which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is a 32 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 7 years. She describes herself to be honest and faithful woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes . She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a very strategic market area and her primary customers are daily customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes leading to varying purchasing power from the customers. Her business goal is to run a profit-oriented big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent and a lender to other customers. Milcah has a motorcycle and she has employed a person who helps daily in providing transportation to residents. 

She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to purchase a water tank for home use. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 40-year-old married women. She has been in carpet manufacturing for the past 12 years. She offers various handmade carpets and is famous in her circle for providing good quality products. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family.

Ms. Naseem is the mother of five daughters and two sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She is also doing sewing work as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to meet her family's needs and requirements effectively. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 10,000 Pakistani rupees to buy additional raw materials including wool, frames, etc., to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials including wool, frames, etc.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a 24 year old university student. He lives in Mafraq with his large family. He has 9 brothers and sisters. Being a responsible, reasonable person, Ashraf knows it is hard for his parents to pay for his university expenses. And therefore he wishes to get the loan so he can pay for his university expenses and get his bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for his university expenses.

loans.name: Paula Katty

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa, dos estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca pero actualmente está enfermo y no trabaja.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas para ofrecer sus productos, ella sale a recorrer cuatro  días a la semana y los fines de semana vende en su local,  vende al contado o deja a crédito a sus clientes más conocidos. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, ella empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que le fue muy bien en su negocio sobretodo en los días de inicio de clases que vendió mucho, sus ganancias fueron muy buenas y que le sirvieron para los estudios de sus hijos ya que tuvo muchos gastos pero gracias al crédito pudo solventar. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa en general pero sobretodo uniformes y ropa interior para niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su esposo mejore y vuelva a sus faenas del mar ya que es muy difícil solventar los gastos ella sola.
texts.en:
The members of the “Progreso Del Mar” (Progress of the Sea) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by national and foreign tourists year round. Most of the people here fish or perform other labors of the sea.

Here we meet Paula. She’s 50 years old, married and as a result has four adult children and one 14 year old. Three of them still live at home, two attend university, and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a fisherman, but he’s ill and not currently working. 

In order to be able to earn some money on her own and help her husband with the household expenses, Paula sells all types of clothing door to door and also out of her home, where she has some display cases to offer her products. She goes out to sell four days a week and on the weekends she sells from her stall where the tourists visit. She sells for cash or offers credit to her best customers and collects every week. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil based on what she needs. She’s been doing this for three years and things are going well. 

Paula started with the money from the first loan she got through the institution. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, especially children’s uniforms and undergarments. She’s been a part of the communal bank for three years,  and she enjoys it because it provides loans. She hopes that her husband will get well and that he is able to return to his labors of the sea. It’s difficult for her to pay all the expenses herself.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, undergarments for children, and other clothing.

loans.name: Tork

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary source of income for Tork’s family. She has been managing a farming business for over 20 years, and she is now 42 years of age. Her focus crops are rice, beans, potatoes and vegetables. Tork is married to a humble man and has four children who are still attending school and need daily allowances.

Tork wants to improve her income so she is now asking for a loan of $750 US to buy rice and bean seeds and potato plants for growing on her farmland. This will enable her to obtain good crop production at harvesting season and; thereby, increase her income to cover her daily needs. Someday, Tork hopes to become a successful entrepreneur in growing her crops.

loans.use: to buy rice and bean seeds and potato plants for growing on her farmland.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun is 36 years old and a resident living in Ornlong Veng district with her spouse and five children, all of whom are still attending school. They help her cultivate rice when they have no schedule at school. Bun is a proud and industrious farmer in her community. With great help from her husband and children, Bun can ensure healthy crops each harvesting season. Even so, she is ambitious about developing her business and pursuing a better standard of living. Bun aims to provide a higher education for all of her children.

Bun is in need of additional capital to grow her business, so she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 riels to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. Hopefully this time she can get better income than in previous years, so that she can save for the future of her family as well as for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lina Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Lina, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en  Guayaquil cuando puede. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen Del Mar" gets together every two weeks in the gorgeous beach resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited all year round by foreign and domestic tourists.  Here, the majority of locals make a living in fishing and other sea industries.  

This is where Lina lives.  She is 50 years old, married and has five adult children.  One of them lives in her home.  Her husband makes a living in the fishing industry. 

In order to carry her weight and help with expenses she makes a living selling all kinds of clothing.  Her selling style is door to door and also sells from her home to customers who visit.  She works every day, gives her customers credit, and charges in two installments.  She purchases her merchandise in Manta or in Guayaquil when she gets a chance.  She has been doing this for four years and it is going really well for her.  

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been part of this communal bank for four years and she likes it because, thanks to her first loan, she started her business.  

Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: Buenas tardes desde Perú, les presento al grupo comunal  “El Eden”, grupo formado por 9 socios todos ellos caracterizados por su solidaridad y deseos de salir adelante. La Sra. Vilma de 75 años de edad es viuda y madre de dos hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la confección de prendas de vestir y en menor medida a costuras de reparación. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina de coser con la cual podrá agilizar sus trabajos y generar mayores ingresos para su hogar. Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que no se da por vencida; asimismo, agradece a todas las personas que a través de Kiva y Edaprospo la ayudan a  cumplir sus metas porque sabe que lo hacen de buena voluntad.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Introducing the communal bank "El Eden" which consists of nine members who are all characterized by their solidarity and desire to succeed.  

Vilma is 75 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children.  She works everyday in garment making as well as some tailoring.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of a sewing machine which will allow her to speed up her work and generate better income for her household.  

Vilma is an enterprising woman and a born fighter that will not give up.  Likewise, she is thankful to all the people within Kiva and Edaprospo that are helping her achieve her goals as she knows they do it through good will.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya, age 47, lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Arhangai province. She has been managing her organic dairy products trading business for 6 years. Currently, she is renting a rental counter at a food market in the center of Arhangai province. She has many regular suppliers and buyers.  Her husband helps with her business. Her two children are students.  

Enhtuya is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase organic curd, organic dried curd, and organic sour milk from the countryside because the dairy season of Mongolia is coming.  Enhtuya is a friendly and brave woman who says, "When my business expands in the next few years, I will build a private house for my family."

loans.use: buy curds and milk to sell

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Tsend-Ayush is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children.  Tsend-Ayush started a shoe production and retail business 3 years ago. She goes to the country-side to sell her products.  Because she has made and sold these products for 3 years, she now has many customers. 

Tsend-Ayush is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import more raw materials for shoes from China because her product demand has increased and is very high now.  If she can make this big order, her working capital will be improved and it will help expanded her business. Her youngest son is sick. With the expanded business and increased income, she does not need to worry her youngest son's treatment fees.

loans.use: buy shoe materials

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is 21 years old.  He is single and does not support any person in the family.  He has been in the hardware business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is his second loan with KADET.  He has successfully repaid the first loan. This loan will be used to buy stock such as tools and pipes for his business.The anticipated profits will be used to diversify his business.  His dreams and hopes are to open other hardware branches outside Kamulu.

loans.use: buy hardware items to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
