She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computer shop business. Meriden has been in this business for 22 years. She earns more income from her general store.

Meriden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her computer shop

loans.name: Laura Veronica

texts.es: Laura Verónica de 23 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar en una vivienda de su propiedad. Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol desde ya hace un tiempo.  Ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos, pone su mejor esfuerzo en lo que produce para darle a sus clientes un producto de buena calidad. Laura es una mujer trabajadora, honrada y responsable que tiene como objetivo sacar a delante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que sus vecinos, amigos y clientela siempre dan buenas referencias de ella. Es por este motivo y por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia que se animo a pedir un crédito a INTEGRAL  que le ayude a cumplir el sueño de ayudar a su familia, dicho crédito le servirá para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abono, pesticida, etc. que le son necesarios para poder producir una cosecha mejor que los años anteriores y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de buenos productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
Laura Verónica is 23 years old and lives with her family in the home she owns. She works growing basic grains like corn and beans, and has been doing so for some time. Since this is her main source of income, she puts her best effort into her work so that she can give her customers a good quality product.
Laura is a hard-working, honest, and responsible woman whose goal is to provide for her family and give them a better quality of life. That is why her neighbors, friends, and customers always give her good references. For this reason and because she needed to provide for her family, she decided to request a loan from Integral, which helps her realize her dream of helping her family. This loan will be used to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. that she needs in order to obtain a better harvest than previous years, so that she can continue to meet her customers' demand for good products.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn, a married mother of three children, works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending.  Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her vulcanizing business.

Jenelyn has been able to sustain her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her vulcanizing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new cart for dried fruit selling business

loans.name: No's Group

texts.en:
No is 54 years old and married with no children. He lives with his wife in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He and his wife earn a living by planting cassava and selling fishes. Together, they can earn about 63,000KHR per day and are able to save about about 27,000KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

No’s group consists of two members living in the same area. This is No's second, and his co-member's sixth, loan with VisionFund. The previous loan he successfully paid back helped his family support their business and improve their living conditions. No is now leading this group to apply for a loan. No will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland as well as more fish for his wife’s business. He hopes to increase his family’s income in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland as well as fish.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Editha works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Editha is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to buy farmlands.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Tumijo

texts.en:
Tumijo works as a rubber worker, with a very minimal wage. Tumijo only works collecting rubber sap, so to pay for the schooling of Daryati is very difficult. Tumijo's family situation is very difficult, because the two brothers of Daryati are mentally disabled.

Currently, Daryati has started school, hoping that her parents can get a Kiva student loan that can meet the cost of her school fees so her parents can later send her younger siblings to school. In the picture, Tumijo, Rawen, and their three children - Daryati and two brothers.

loans.use: To pay educational fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old, married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. Arlene is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

Arlene has been raising pigs for 8 years and has previously borrowed twice from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Daniel De Jesus

texts.es: Daniel de Jesús de 36 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica desde ya hace mucho tiempo al cultivo de maíz y frijol, siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos ya que en las épocas de poco cultivo trabaja como jornalero para poder tener ingresos extra y así no dejar de llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar. Daniel se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, humilde y responsable,  además de ser conocido por vender productos de buena calidad, es por eso que año con año pone su mayor esfuerzo en sus cultivos ya que su clientela siempre espera lo mejor de él. Es por eso que se acercó a las agencias de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayude a la compra de todos los insumos necesarios para poder llevar acabo una nueva siembra, tales como abono, pesticidas, semillas, etc. y de esta forma poder generar los ingresos necesarios para poder darle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Daniel de Jesús, 36, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s been a corn and bean farmer for a long time; it’s his main source of income although during low agricultural season he works as a day laborer in order to earn extra income and continue to provide sustenance for his humble home.

Daniel is noted for being a very hardworking, humble, responsible man in addition to being known for selling good quality products which is why year to year he puts his best effort into the crops since his customers always expect the best from him.

This is why he approached Integral’s agencies to request a new loan that will help him buy supplies needed to produce a good crop such as manure, pesticide, seeds, etc. thus being able to generate funds necessary to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Elenilson

texts.es: José Elenilson de 33 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Se dedica desde ya hace muchos años al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, por lo que tiene ya mucha experiencia en su trabajo, esta es su principal fuente de ingresos pero cuando la época de cosecha termina y hay oportunidad se dedica a la carpintería para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Los vecinos y clientela dan muy buenas referencias de José, lo definen como una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, que siempre pone su mejor esfuerzo en lo que hace para dar a su clientela los mejores productos del mercado. Él tiene como sueño darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para pagar el alquiler de una parcela y comprar semilla, abono y otros insumos para poder cultivar sus productos y darle a su clientela los mejore productos del mercado.
texts.en: José Elenilson, 33, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s been growing basic grains like corn and beans for many years so he has quite a bit of experience in his line of work.  This is his main source of income but when the harvest is in and the opportunity arises he works in carpentry to be able to bring sustenance to his home.  His neighbors and customers give José very good references.  They describe him as a very hardworking, honest, responsible person who always puts his best effort into what he does to give his customers the best products in the market.  His dream is to provide his family with a better quality of life which is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to pay for the lease on a parcel of land and to buy seeds, manure and other supplies to be able to farm his products and give his customers the best market products.

loans.use: to lease farmland and to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mirah

texts.en:
Mirah works as a laborer, earning an uncertain income every month. Mirah has erratic employment that depends on the time of planting and harvesting rice. Mirah's employment makes family life minimal and limited, but Mirah would like Ayu to stay in school so that her children will be useful. Mirah is eager to get the funds through the student loan program to finance Ayu's schooling.

Ayu lives in the village of Grugu, surrounded by rice fields and away from an access road, so it is not reached by rural transport. But Ayu does not become discouraged from staying in school, which she needs to do in order to realize her ideals. She wants to be a professional accountant. Ayu hopes that this loan will ease the burden on her parents. In the picture, Ayu and Mirah her mother.

loans.use: To pay educational fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Rusmadi

texts.en:
Rusmadi works as a farm laborer. He is the father of Joko, who now attends vocational school. Rusmadi's income is uncertain, so family life is very minimal. Rusmadi wants the kids to still have to go to school, for their future. Rusmadi does not want his children to suffer the same fate as him. Due to economic factors, Rusmadi wants to ask for a loan from Kiva through the student loan program. In the picture, Joko and parents (Rusmadi and wife). 

Joko has a strong desire to stay in school. Born as the third of four brothers, Joko once took a year out of school. He worked odd jobs to save for school fees. The assistance of the Kiva student loan program is expected to help Joko to finish school. Joko's ideal is to open his own bike shop.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Wagirah

texts.en:
Wagirah is the grandmother of Eka. She is a grandmother who must feed three grandchildren. Wagirah's income is from her husband's pension. That is enough for the living expenses of Wagirah and her grandchildren every day. Eka hopes to stay in school, and Wagirah wants to follow the student loan program of Kiva. 

Eka is the eldest of three brothers. Already at birth, he was in the foster care of his grandmother. Until now, Eka's cost of living has been borne by his grandfather and grandmother. Eka's parents are divorced. With the student loan program of Kiva, Eka can finish school, so Grandma does not need to use Grandfather's pension money. Eka hopes to finish school directly and work as a bank employee. In the picture, Eka and Wagirah his grandmother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Samijan

texts.en:
Samijan works as a farmer in his village. He has a considerable number of children amounting to seven. With a very low income, he must support his family. Samijan worries that Dewi can not continue her education. Therefore, Samijan is venturing to borrow through the student loan program of Kiva.

To be a professional accountant is the goal of Dewi. She is in her first year at the vocational school. Dewi had fears and worries that she would have to quit school. With the student loan program of Kiva, Dewi hopes to finish school and help her brothers. In the picture, Dewi and Samijan her father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Supini

texts.en:
The mother of Firdaus, Supini, wants him to stay in school. But due to economic factors, she has concerns. The husband of Firdaus's mother works as a farmer with only seasonal work. His daily income is uncertain. It is only enough for food in everyday life. Through the student loan program of Kiva, Mrs. Supini hopes Firdaus can finish his studies at a vocational school. In the picture, Firdaus and his mother.

Firdaus is currently studying at the vocational school. He wants to be a reliable computer technician. With the student loan program of Kiva, he hopes to achieve his goals in order to help his parents and other relatives.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de 37 años de edad, vive en su vivienda propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Se dedica desde ya hace mucho tiempo a la crianza de pollos como su principal fuente de ingresos, pero cuando hay época de cultivos y tiene la oportunidad y los medios para hacerlo también se dedican a la agricultura para poder ayudar a la humilde economía familiar. Roberto recibe ayuda de su esposa que con grandes esfuerzos se dedica a la costura y juntos tienen el sueño de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Roberto se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honesta y responsable que da su mejor esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, por lo que se ha ganado el respeto y la admiración de familia, amigos y en especial de su clientela que siempre lo prefieren. Es por su gran compromiso de siempre entregar los mejores productos, que decidió solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar más pollos y concentrado para que estos sean de la mejor calidad para su fiel clientela. y a su vez la compra de insumos para su terreno y comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas, pesticidas entre otros.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos, 37, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He’s been raising chickens for a long time now; it’s his main source of income.  When farming season is high and he has the opportunity and the means to do so he also works in agriculture to be able to help his humble family economy.  Roberto’s wife helps him working with much effort sewing and together they dream of providing their family with a better quality of life.

Roberto is characterized by being a hardworking, honest, responsible person who puts his best effort into the work he does which has won him the respect and admiration of his family, friends and especially his customers who prefer him always.  Because of his commitment to always produce the best products, he’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy more chicks and feed so that they will be top quality for his loyal customers.  At the same time, he will buy farm supplies, seeds, manure, insecticide, pesticide and others.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lindawati

texts.en:
Lindawati, a grandmother who does not work, must make a living from her brothers. Priscillia, one of her grandchildren, is watched by Linda. Because the mother of Priscillia has died and her father has remarried, her father was no longer concerned about the life of Priscillia. Priscillia's grandmother worried about her education, so she applied for loans through the student loan program of Kiva. In the picture, Priscillia and Lindawati her grandmother.
Priscillia lived with her grandmother. She has a fear that her brothers can not help her in school again, and she should quit school. With the student loan program, she hopes to continue her studies to completion.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Daryun

texts.en:
Daryun is the parent of Nining, a farm worker whose income is very minimal. Daryun earns just enough income to finance the family's daily needs. Daryun hopes Nining have not to drop out of school, because Nining is the only hope for the family of Daryun. Through the student loan program of Kiva, Daryun has applied for a loan to finance Nining's school fees at the vocational school. In the picture, Daryun and Nining, his daughter.


Nining is a student at the vocational school. She wants to be an accounting professional. However, because of economic limitations, she has a sense of concern that she will quit school, because her parent only works as a laborer. Nining expects that with the assistance through the Kiva student loan program, she can become an accounting professional, which can help the family.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Jeminem

texts.en:
Jeminem works as a farm laborer, as well as her husband. Because she is just a peasant, and her husband's income with Jeminem's is just enough for everyday family life, Jeminem has an immense hope for Reni. She wants Reni to finish her studies at a vocational school and quickly get a job in order to help her sisters. Jeminem applies for a loan through Kiva of the student loan program to pay for Reni to finish school.

Reni is a vocational school student and lives in a barren area. Reni is very worried about dropping out of school. Because parental income is uncertain, this motivates Reni to be more enterprising and industrious, in order to finish school and get a job according to her ideals as a computer technician. Reni hopes to help ease the burden on parents. In the picture, Reni and Jeminem her mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling live shrimps and crabs in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional shrimps and crabs to sell.

Andresita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Andresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional shrimp and crabs to sell

loans.name: Wasiyah

texts.en:
Wasiyah is the mother of Restu. Her husband is working as a seasonal farmer. His income is uncertain. It depends on the time of planting and harvesting rice, and even then it is only enough to meet daily needs. Wasiyah as a mother is very worried that Restu cannot finish school. Wasiyah expects to take part in the Kiva student loan program, so that Restu can finish school. In the picture, Restu and Wasiyah his mother.

Restu is a student at a vocational school. His goal is to become a professional computer expert, but he has fear and anxiety about having to drop out of school. With the student loan program, he hopes to finish school.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa a 42 ans, elle est mère de deux enfants qui ont 13 et 16 ans et qui vont tous les deux à l'école. Le mari d'Akossiwa exerce la profession de revendeur. Akossiwa est depuis 10 ans revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. Elle vend ses produits à domicile. Elle sollicite un prêt chez WAGES afin d'augmenter son stock en produit d'alimentation. Elle compte réinvestir ses futurs profits dans son entreprise. Elle aimerait à l'avenir pouvoir acheter elle même à  l'étranger ses produits en gros et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa, age 42, is the mother of two children ages 13 and 16 who both go to school. Her husband is a reseller. 

Akossiwa has been selling general food products for ten years, working from her home. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to replenish her stock of merchandise.  

She plans to reinvest future profits into her business. In the long term, she would like to travel abroad to buy wholesale. She also wants to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Josué Antonio

texts.es: Josué Antonio es un joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante en la vida, a sus 23 años de edad trabaja junto a su padre, así mismo se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. Con el deseo de salir adelante Josué realiza la actividad de sembrar maíz para posteriormente comercializar, este trabajo lo realiza con su padre, quien le enseño desde  muy pequeño el arte de la siembra.  Josué solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz y de esta forma aumentar la cantidad de producción de maíz, con esto él desea aumentar las ganancias que percibe junto a su padre, ya que esto sería para solventar los gastos familiares como la compra de alimentos, y así mismo para costear sus estudios universitarios, lo cual es una de las ilusiones más grandes que Josué sostiene y así de esta manera tener un mejor futuro para el y su padre.
texts.en:
Josué Antonio is a young man who very much wants to get ahead in life.  At the age of 23 he’s working with his father while also attending university.  Wanting to get ahead, Josué is growing corn for subsequent sale.  He does this work with his father who taught him how to plant when he was a little boy.  

Josué is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy larger amounts of corn thus improving corn production.  He hopes this way to increase the profits he earns with his father to cover family expenses like food purchases while also being able to pay for his university studies which is one of the greatest hopes Josué has thus resulting in a better future for him and his father.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria,  es una señora muy alegra y emprendedora que vive junto a sus 3 hijos y su compañero de vida quien al igual que ella se dedica a la agricultura. Ana posee una pequeña parcela en la que siembra maíz y diferentes hortalizas como: lechuga, rábanos, zanahorias y otras más, las cuales comercializa en diferentes lugares, vendiendo por mayor. Sus hijos y esposo le ayudan a realizar la actividad de siembra y también a darle todo el mantenimiento necesario para brindar un mejor producto, el cual posee un mercado muy amplio. Ana solicita un préstamo con todo el deseo de mejorar su negocio y de esta forma comprar mayor cantidad de semilla y así aumentar sus ventas, las cuales son esenciales para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Gloria is a very cheerful, enterprising woman living with her three children and her life companion who also works in agriculture like she does.  Ana has a small parcel planted with corn and various vegetables like lettuce, radishes, carrots and others that she sells in various places at wholesale.  Her children and her husband help her do her planting and also to provide all the necessary crop maintenance to produce a good product for which she has a wide market.  Ana is asking for a loan wishing to improve her business.  She will buy a larger amount of seeds to increase her sales which are essential for her family’s support.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es:
Diana es una joven de 29 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual es una ciudad que recibe muchos turistas en todo el año ya que van a visitar uno de los atractivos turísticos más característicos de la zona, la cual son las líneas de nazca, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, pallar, tuna, cochinilla, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Diana estudio la carrera técnica de computación e informática y gracias a ello inicio su negocio de tipeos, escaneos, impresiones y también la venta de recargas virtuales, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá instalar divisiones de drywall con lo cual construira un pequeño locutorio en su negocio, de esta manera poder tener un ingreso mas y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio mas grande”.
texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old. She lives in the city of Nazca, which is a city that receives many tourists all year round who come to visit the tourist attractions that are characteristic of the area, which are the Nazca lines. The people there work in agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, lima beans, prickly pear fruit, and cochineal, among other things. When she has some free time, Diana likes to eat one of her favorite meals, which is the delicious rice with chicken.

With much hard work and dedication, Diana studied computer, information, and internet systems. Thanks to this, she started a business that does typing, scanning, photocopies, and also sells cell phone minutes. She spends approximately 8 hours per day at her business and she can take tend to up to 15 customers each day. She believes things are going well for her business because she is friendly to her customers and, above all, because she has a great desire to get ahead.

Diana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided that she can purchase drywall to install a small internet business in her home, and in this way have some more income, improve her quality of life, and continue working to make her greatest dream come true: to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy drywall to install an internet business in her home

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo junto al cual se dedica a trabajar para contar con todo lo necesario en su hogar. 

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de vacas, cabras, cerdos y pollos de engorde, de los cuales comercializa leche, huevos, diferentes tipos de queso, crema y así mismo comercializa sus carnes al venderlas al rastro que es donde se realiza la matanza del animal y luego se distribuye a supermercados, quienes son sus principales clientes y además en el mercado de su localidad. 

Rosa tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este oficio, por lo que es muy conocida, lo que le permite contar con varios clientes fijos. 

Ahora con el deseo de poder aumentar sus ventas, ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la esperanza de contar con el dinero necesario para comprar vacas, cerdos y cabras, también alimento y vitaminas necesarias para el fortalecimiento de los animales y así de esta forma mejorar la calidad y  aumentar la producción de leche, productos lácteos y carne, lo que le permitirá renovar y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira  lives with her children and husband with whom she works to be able to have all things they need in their homestead.

Rosa makes a living rearing cattle, goats pigs and poultry to fatten from which she sells milk, eggs, different types of cheese, cream, and she also sells the meat at the markets where they butcher the animal and distributes it to supermarkets, who are her principle clients as well as smaller local markets. 

Rosa's been in the business for 30 years and because of that she is very well know and that allows her to have various regular customers.

Now with the goal to increase her sales she requests a loan with "Integral", with the hope to have the money she needs to buy cattle, pigs and goats and the food and vitamins necessary for the strengthening of the animals and this way improve their quality of life and increase the production of milk, milk products and meat which will allow her to renew and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cows, pigs, and goats as  well as the necessary food and vitimans to raise the animals

loans.name: Jesús De Nazaret  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días los 2 socios y las 11 socias  del Banco Comunal Jesús De Nazaret, los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Adriana, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y la menor de  16 años de edad la cual estudian en colegio y es la que aun vive con ellos. Su esposo tiene un taller de soldadura.

Ella es un ama de casa muy trabajadora y para ganar algo por su cuenta trabaja en un local de venta de hamburguesas, trabaja en las tardes y noches y le pagan un sueldo mensual. El crédito es para el negocio de su esposo, el mismo que fabrica muchas obras con el metal como puertas, ventanas, estructuras metálicas, etc. Él trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ayuda de dos operarios a quienes  les paga un sueldo mensual, lleva más de 20 años con su taller y siempre ha tenido trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras, pinturas y otros materiales que emplea su esposo para elaborar sus obras. Este es el segundo  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como a sus compañeros.

Su sueño es terminar su casa ya que aún le falta mucho.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The two male and eleven female members of the “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) communal bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo.  They carry out a variety of activities like general commerce and services, among others.

One of the members of this group is Adriana, 48.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children: an adult and a 16-year-old who attends secondary school and is the one still living with them.  Her husband has a welding shop.

She is a very hardworking housewife who in order to earn a little on her own works at a hamburger stand afternoons and evenings and is paid a monthly salary.   The loan is for her husband’s business.  He manufactures a variety of metal objects like doors, windows, metallic structures, etc.  He works Monday through Saturday with the help of two employees who he pays monthly salaries.  He’s had the shop more than 20 years and has always had work.

This loan is to buy metal, welding supplies, paint and other supplies her husband uses to do his work.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they give her and her fellow members.  Her dream is to finish her house which still has a long way to go.

The small photo is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy metal, welding supplies, paint and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rosa Elvires

texts.es: Rosa Elvires, de 26 años de edad vive junto a su esposo de 30 años y 3 hijos en casa propia.  Con mucho esfuerzo los 3 pequeños de Rosa están estudiando en la escuela cerca de su vivienda. Es ama de casa y se caracteriza por ser; una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y sincera. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos  es decir siembra  frijoles y arroz. Y cuando no hay tiempo de cosecha realiza trabajos temporalmente con su esposo, como participar en la corta de caña de azúcar, lavar o planchar para otras personas a fin de nunca falte de comer en su casa. Rosa siente que necesita incrementar sus cosechas ya que tiene un terreno de una manzana ubicado en su casa, es mucho espacio y no tiene las posibilidades de sembrar en el, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar la ayuda y poder comprar insumos agrícolas como lo son: semillas, abonos y venenos  para plagas. Y así ella podrá incrementar más sus cosechas y éstas poderlas vender para lograr cubrir las necesidades que posee, agradece la ayuda que le brindara y espera solventar la deuda adquirida antes de tiempo
texts.en:
Rosa, 26, lives with her 30-year-old husband and their 3 children in their own home. Through much effort, Rosa's 3 children are studying at a school near her house. She is a hardworking, honest, and sincere homemaker. Rosa plants basic grains such as beans, rice, and so forth. When harvest season is over, she also takes temporary jobs with her husband, such as working for others to harvest sugar cane, and washing and ironing for others so that there is always food on the table.

Rosa feels she should increase her harvest, since she has a manzana of land around her house. This is a large area to plant; therefore, she came to INTEGRAL to request help to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. She will then be able to increase her harvests and sell them to cover her household expenses. She is grateful for the help offered to her and expects to pay off her debt early.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Señoras del Taguan, vive por la comunidad de San Bartolome que pertenece al cantón Sígsig, ubicado al Sureste de la Provincia del Azuay, su económica se sustenta en la agricultura, la manufactura y comercio, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables y gentiles que luchan diariamente para mejorar su economía.

Doña María tiene 70 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María pasa en un tratamiento constante ya que sufre de diabetes, agradece a Dios porque todos los miembros de su familia se encuentran por el momento gozando de muy buena salud. 

Ella se dedica a la agricultura y las verduras que cosecha es para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar, también en casa se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, cerdos y ganado, estas actividad es lo ha aprendido desde que tenía una corta edad, le gusta trabajar en esta actividad porque le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando pollos y alimento para sus animales, en la cancelación del mismo se atrasado un poco debido a su enfermedad pero ya realizo la cancelación total. Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y ganado para seguir con su negocio.
 
La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos le dan la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Señoras del Taguan” communal bank and lives in the community of San Bartolomé that belongs to Sígsig Canton located in the southeast of Azuay Province.  Its economy is based on agriculture, manufacturing and commerce.  Its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples and are kind, pleasant people who strive daily to improve their economy.

María is 70-years-old, a widow and has four children who are all married adults living on their own.  The house she lives in his hers.

María is under constant treatment because she has diabetes and she thanks God because all the members of her family are currently enjoying very good health.

She works in agriculture and the vegetables she grows are both to sell and for home consumption.  She also raises chickens, pigs and cattle to sell.  She learned these activities when she was still quite young and likes working in this activity because it’s made it possible for her to cover household expenses and to raise her family.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy chicks and animal feed.  She was a little late in repaying it because of her illness but she’s now totally paid it back.  She will use this loan to buy chicks and cattle to continue with her business.  She likes her communal bank because the loans give her the opportunity to improve her business and her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy chicks and cattle.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Emily has been farming sugarcane for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and has 5 children. Evelyn is married, and all of her children go to school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and she has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from renting a pedicab. Ma. Fe is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Nelida Lilana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Nelida es socia del banco comunal Señoras del Taguan, vive por la comunidad de San Bartolome que pertenece al cantón Sígsig, ubicado al Sureste de la Provincia del Azuay, su económica se sustenta en la agricultura, la manufactura y comercio, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables y gentiles que luchan diariamente para mejorar su economía.

La Señorita Nelida tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre quien se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señorita Nelida se encuentra gozando de muy buena salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia. 
Ella trabaja en un local comercial desde hace 3 años por la necesidad de mejorar su situación económica, también en su casa cría y vende cerdos.

 El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cerdos y le va muy bien en la cría de estos animales, en la cancelación de dicho crédito no ha tenido dificultad alguna y a  realizando los pagos en las fechas indicadas. Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de más cerdos para continuar con su negocio. 

El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo y la solidaridad del grupo.
texts.en:
Nélida’s a member of the “Señoras del Taguan” communal bank.  She lives in the community of San Bartolomé belonging to Sígsig Canton located in the southeast of Azuay Province.  Its economy is based on agriculture, manufacturing and commerce.  Its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.  They are nice, kind people who strive daily to improve their economy.

Nélida is 19-years-old, single and lives with her mother who works in agriculture; the house she lives in his hers.  Nélida is enjoying very good health as are all the members of her family.

She’s been working in a commercial locale for the last three years because she needed to improve her economic situation; she also raises pigs at home to sell.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy pigs; she does quite well raising these animals.  She had no problem repaying the loan and made her payments on schedule.  She will use this new loan to buy more pigs to continue in business.  She likes the communal bank because of its fellowship and group solidarity.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Tierra Fértil  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tierra Fertil está formado por 10 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle que está ubicada en la parte suroriental de la ciudad de Cuenca, es de clima frió, tiene varios lugares para visitar y vivir momentos familiares. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes actividades para solventar los gastos de sus hogares, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Aída, tiene 62 años, es casada y en unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes todos son mayores de edad, 3 de sus hijos son casados y viven  independientes, un es egresado de la universidad y su ultimo hijo está cursando los estudios universitarios. Su esposo labora como conserje, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Aída se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus nietos, también  en casa cría y vende cerdos y vacas, también se dedica a la agricultura y sus cosechas son solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace cuatro año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en  la compra de cerdos.

 Su sueño es tener un tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The “Tierra Fértil” (Fertile Ground) communal bank has ten members who live in Valle Parrish located in the southeast part of the city of Cuenca.  It has a cold climate and several places to apt for family outings.  Its residents raise animals, farm and are merchants; many of them go out to work in various jobs in the city to cover household expenses.  They are kind, pleasant people who preserve the culture and traditions of their peoples.

One of this group’s members is Aída, 62.  She’s married and has five children who are all adults now.  Three of her children are married and live on their own, one is a university graduate and the youngest is attending university.  Her husband works as a caretaker and the house she lives in is hers.

Aída does household chores and cares for her grandchildren.  She also raises pigs and cows at home to sell and also works in agriculture but her crops are only for home consumption.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for four and a half years and will use her new loan to buy pigs.  Her dream is to have a home-based store.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. Roselyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlyn works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and cafeteria. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Merlyn has sustained her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Alnie

texts.en:
Alnie is 27 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Alnie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alnie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alnie has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alnie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Elma has been in this business for 14 years. Elma earns more income from farming sugarcane, from her cafeteria & from pig fattening.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restauarant business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 36 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Regina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft drinks, snack foods, eggs, etc.

In the future Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia muy humilde ubicada en zona marginal del país. Es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora que siempre le ha interesado darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.  Ella se dedica a la labor de oficios domésticos y junto a sus esposo posee un terreno donde cultivan granos básicos como lo son: frijoles, arroz, maicillo entre otros y así estos los venden a precios accesibles para poder subsistir junto a su numerosa familia. María tiene el deseo de ampliar su cosecha es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de los diferentes insumos agrícolas como lo son: semillas, abonos e insecticidas. Está segura y confía en Dios que con la ayuda recibida su  condición de vida cambiará y agradece de antemano la ayuda que recibirá. Espera poder solventar la deuda antes del tiempo acordado.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives with her husband and children in her own, very humble house located in a marginal zone of the country.  She’s a tenacious, hardworking woman who has always been interested in giving her children better living conditions.  She works doing domestic chores and together with her husband grows basic grains like beans, rice and sorghum, among others that they sell at affordable prices in order to subsist alongside her large family.  

María wants to expand her crops which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy the various farm supplies like seeds, manure and insecticide.  She is sure and trusts in God that with the help received her living conditions will change.  She is giving thanks in advance for the helps she’ll receive.  She hopes to be able to repay the loan ahead of time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Almel

texts.en:
This is Almel, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Norman, a seaman, and she is mother of her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Almel operates a silkscreen printing business. Silkscreen printing is the process of creating a stencil in a mesh screen then using a squeegee and pushing the inks through the mesh onto the shirt or garment. Clients go to her with a request for printing; they give their desired pattern or design. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2000 per week.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like paint, screen, and shirts. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Almel dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for silk screen, film and paint needed in her business.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy is aged 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and five children in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Out of her five children, some are still in school while the others are paid workers helping support the family. She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their income by planting sesame and beans. Having been in this business for six years, together they can earn about US$11 per day. 

Hoy is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back the prior loan, which has helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 625 with VisionFund and she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor costs. She hopes to grow her business and raise more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is 30 years old. He is married and lives in small village of Gardabani District with his family: his wife-Giunel, their 2-year-old child and his parents.  His father is a teacher and he teaches in the village school. Other family members run an agricultural business. They have two calves and a plot of land, where tomatoes are grown.  They work hard on their plot during spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest.  Along with the agricultural business Azer is busy with sewing. He has his own sewing workshop and gets orders from the local population.  

Azer requested a loan for purchasing calves. He will raise them and sell them after several months. Grown calves will be sold for a good price. Thus, he wants to expand his agricultural business in order to make it more profitable.  Due to the above-mentioned, living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura, se siente orgulloso de la experiencia adquirida porque eso le ayuda a obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es muy accesible y con un suelo fértil, todo lo producido lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y posee mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precio accesible; Marco es un hombre dedicado a su labor, responsable, honesto y muy humilde, piensa que la fuerza de voluntad, es la fuerza y el arma mas poderosa para alanzar el éxito, él tiene voluntad de aumentar las ventas de su siembra por eso quiere producir aun mas y necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herramientas, etc. Marco Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago, se compromete a pagar la deuda y a la tiene la confianza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio, 40, lives with his life companion and their children.  He grows corn and has worked in agriculture for many years.  He feels proud of the experience he’s acquired because it helps him produce better harvests.  His parcel of land is very accessible and has fertile soil.  Everything he produces is sold around his community and he has many customers because people prefer him because he always has what they need: quality products at affordable prices.

Marco is a man who is dedicated to his work; he’s honest, responsible and very humble.  He thinks that willpower is the strength and most powerful weapon to reach success.  He is determined to increase sales from his crops so he wants to produce still more and needs investment capital to do so which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn seeds, manure, tools, etc.  Marco Antonio has good payment references and commits to repay the loan; he’s confident that he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Raul

texts.es: Oscar de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite mejorar cada día su labor y al mismo tiempo le ayuda a conseguir las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo tiene gran potencial agrícola y se encuentra ubicado en un lugar muy accesible, todo lo que produce lo ocupa para la venta en los diferentes alrededores de la comunidad ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo buscan por el producto de primera calidad y a precio bajo además de un buen servicio; Oscar es un hombre enérgico, trabajador, responsable pero sobre todo honesto, quiere tomar su futuro en sus propias manos por eso se esfuerza por cumplir sus sueños, en esta época de siembra quiere aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, herramienta, etc. Oscar tiene buena referencias de pago, tiene la certeza de poder cancelar la deuda y a la vez la esperanza de llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Oscar, 60, lives with his life companion and their children.  He works in agriculture, especially growing corn and beans.  He has a lot of valuable experience that allows him to improve his work more every day while at the same time helping him to obtain the best harvests.  The parcel of land he farms has great agricultural potential and it’s located in a very accessible spot.  Everything he produces he sells in various places neighboring his community.  He has quite a large clientele because people seek him out because of his top quality products, affordable prices and good service.

Oscar is an energetic, hardworking, responsible but above all, honest man.  He wants to grasp his future in his own hands which is why he strives to reach his dreams.  He wants to expand his crops this planting season which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, tools, etc.  Oscar has good payment references and he’s certain that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time hoping to bring economic security home.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sinay's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sinay is a 43-year-old mother of three children; two of them are still dependent on her and in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of the family’s income. They have been in this business for almost ten years, earning about 12,800 KHR per day.

Sinay’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is a second-cycle client with VisionFund and she successfully paid back the first loan, which has helped her improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her co-member who is just with VisionFund this cycle to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have more healthy crops and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for animal sales business

loans.name: Bakhar

texts.en:
Bakhar is 55 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of Gardabani District with her husband, Bairam, and their 28-year-old son. Her son works in construction and gets a service fee for his work. 

Bakhar and Bairam are busy with an agricultural business. They have a plot of land where they grow greens. They sell harvested greens in Rustavi open market. They also buy vegetables and fruits from local farmers and sell them on the local open market. The average total monthly income of the family is 900 laris. 

Bakhar has requested a loan for purchasing a car. With the car, Bakhar and Bairam will be able to move comfortably and easily. This will save the costs related to selling their agricultural products. Thus, they will decrease their transportation costs and increase their income accordingly. They will spend the largest portion of the income to develop the business. As a result they will be able to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car to help in their business

loans.name: Atsupi

texts.fr: Atsupi a 36 ans , elle est mariée et a deux enfant de 2 et 5 ans. Le plus âgé va à l'école. Le mari de Atsupi est employé dans une société de transport. Atsupi est quant à elle, depuis 1 an, vendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle sollicite un crédit chez Wages afin d'augmenter le stock de sa boutique. Elle compte réinvestir ses profits dans sa petite entreprise. A l'avenir elle aimerait devenir grossiste et gagner des revenus suffisants pour assurer une éducation de qualité à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Atsupi is 36 years old, she is married and has two children who are 2 and 5 years old. The oldest goes to school. Atsupi's husband is employed by a transport company. As for herself, Atsupi has been selling general food items for 1 year. 

She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to increase the stock of her shop. She plans to reinvest her profits in her little business. In the future she would like to become a wholesaler and make enough income to ensure a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ihudiya

texts.fr: Ihudiya est une jeune coiffeuse. Elle a démarré son activité l'année dernière. Son activité nécessite un capital initial lui permettant d'acheter dans un nombre suffisamment important des mèches, des perruques et d'autres produits de coiffure. C'est dans le but d'augmenter son stock dans ces produits qu'elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages. Elle compte réinvestir les profits qu'elle réalisera dans son activité. A long terme elle espère pouvoir ouvrir un véritable salon de coiffure avec des apprentis. Une telle activité lui offrirait une base financière pour assurer les besoins de sa future famille.
texts.en: Ihudiya is a young hairdresser. She started her business last year. It needs starting capital allowing her to buy a sufficient amount of hair extensions, wigs, and other hairstyling products. With the goal of increasing her inventory of these products, she is requesting a loan from WAGES. She intends to reinvest the profits she will make back into her business. In the long term, she hopes to be able to open a real hair salon with apprentices. Such a business would provide her with a financial base to ensure she can meet the needs of her future family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, weaves, wigs, and hair products

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une jeune vendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale de 29 ans. Elle possède sa propre boutique depuis deux ans. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages afin d'augmenter le stock de son activité. Elle compte réinvestir les profits qu'elle réalisera dans son entreprise pour la faire davantage évoluer. A l'avenir elle aimerait agrandir encore sa boutique dans l'espoir de dégager des revenus suffisants pour assurer l'épanouissement de sa future famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a young 29 year old seller of general foodstuffs. She has owned her own shop for two years. She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to increase the stock of her business. She plans to reinvest the profits that she will make in her business to make it continue to grow. In the future she would like to expand her shop even more in the hope of realizing sufficient income to ensure the self-fulfillment of her future family.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
As a responsible housewife, Melita engages in buying and selling fresh meat in the public market to help her husband in generating income. She is 42 years old, is married and has five school-aged children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she and her husband need to increase their income to cover their daily necessities and finance the education of their children. 

To increase her income, Melita aims to sell more fresh meat to gain a higher income. Because of financial difficulties, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of fresh meat, dressed chicken, fish and frozen foods to sell. She mentioned that her loan will enable her to work out her plan and hopes that she will be successful someday as she continues to work hard and endure hardships.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fresh meat, dressed chicken, fish and frozen foods to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick vit avec sa femme et ses deux enfants de 8 et 12 ans à Lomé. Ses deux enfants sont scolarisés. La femme de Patrick est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. A 47 ans, Patrick est vendeur des cartes de recharge, il sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages afin de développer cette activité. Il désire augmenter son stock dans le but de devenir un jour grossiste. Sur le plan familial il aimerait assurer une meilleure scolarisation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Patrick lives in Lomé with his wife and two children, aged 8 and 12 years old. His two children are in school. His wife is a grocer. Patrick is 47 years old and sells mobile minutes recharge cards. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to develop this business. He would like to increase his inventory with the goal of becoming a wholesaler one day. With regard to the family, he would like to ensure a better education for his children.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa est gérante et propriétaire d'un pressing. A 37 ans elle a un enfant âgé de 10 ans et qui va à l'école. Son mari est quant à lui revendeur. Afiwa sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES afin d'acheter une machine à laver et à sécher. Les bénéfices que lui feront gagner ces nouvelles machines lui permettront d'acheter les produits nécessaires au pressing en gros pour une meilleure rentabilité. Elle espère à long terme pouvoir ouvrir un second pressing et surtout posséder sa propre maison.
texts.en: Afiwa is the manager and owner of a dry cleaning shop. She is 37 years old and has a 10-year-old child, who is going to school. As for her husband, he is a retailer. Afiwa is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a washer and dryer. The profits that these new machines will earn her will enable her to buy in bulk the necessary goods for her shop, so that it is more profitable. In the long term, she hopes to open a second dry cleaning shop and, especially, to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy a washer and dryer for clothing

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de gran  potencial agrícola y en un lugar muy accesible, comercia en todas las zonas cercanas a la localidad y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles además con un buen servicio; Juan es un hombre decidido, entregado a su labor siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que lo hagan llegar al éxito, en esta temporada de cosecha quiere aumentar la producción para así poder aumentar las ganancias,  pero necesita capital para invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, frijol, insecticida, abono, herramienta, etc. Juan Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez de darle a su familia la vida completa como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is 40 years old and lives with his family.  He grows corn, sorghum and beans.  He has worked as a farmer for several years, and the experience has been highly valuable.  Over the years he has learned to obtain very good harvests.

The land that he cultivates is in a fertile agricultural area, and the location is very accessible.  He sells his products in all of the surrounding areas.  He has many customers; they prefer to buy from him because he always has what they need at good prices, and he provides good service.

He is a dedicated man who is always looking for new opportunities to be successful.  In this season he wants to expand his production in order to increase his earnings, but he needs capital to make investments in his business. Thus, he is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy corn, beans, and sorghum for planting, along with insecticide, fertilizer, tools and other items.

Juan Antonio has good credit references from those who know him.  He will be responsible and pay off his loan, and at the same time provide his family with the full life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and sorghum for planting, along with insecticide, fertilizer and tools.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es: Ruby compró telas por rollos de mayor volumen con los que fabricó sudaderas estudiantiles y suéteres; todo esto fue gracias a su credikiva, con el cual ganó clientela, respondió oportunamente a ellos y genera más ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará tela para uniformes e insumos,  porque tiene pedidos de uniformes de las instituciones con las que ha convenido fabricarlos para sus estudiantes, con buenos precios pues ahora compra en mayor volumen y traslada ese ahorro que logra a los precios de venta, que la hacen mas competitivos. Ella envía este mensaje a los financiadoras de Kiva “Su apoyo incondicional es muy importante, ya que contribuyen a mejorar la condiciones de vida de muchos Colombianos.
texts.en:
Ruby bought rolls of fabric in bulk, which she used to make student hoodies and sweaters. This was all thanks to her credikiva, which enabled her to increase her clientele, respond to them and generate more profit. 

Ruby is currently applying for a new credikiva, which she will invest in the purchase of supplies and fabric for uniforms, because she receives uniform orders for students from institutions for whom she has agreed to make garments. She can offer these at a good price as she now buys in larger volumes, and through this saving she can achieve these prices, making her merchandise more competitive. 

Ruby sends the following message to the funders of Kiva - "Your unconditional support is very important, as you are helping to improve the living conditions of many Colombians."

loans.use: to purchase supplies in bulk and fabric for making uniforms.

loans.name: Ayewoubo

texts.fr: Revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique et cela depuis 2009, Mr Ayewoubo est âgé de 55ans. Il a 07 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Sa femme est revendeuse. Il s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé et sollicite ce second prêt pour augmenter son stock. Il voudrait avec les profits réalisés, ouvrir une autre boutique et assurer la formation universitaire de sa fille.
texts.en: A retailer of grocery items in a shop since 2009, Mr. Ayewoubo is 55 years old and has seven children, of whom two are in school. His wife is a retailer. He gets his supplies generally from Lomé and is requesting this second loan to increase his inventory. He would like to use the profits he makes to open another grocery store and to ensure his daughter's university education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena de cincuenta y ocho años  de edad vive junto a sus nietos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno de  cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, cercano a donde reside, todo lo que produce lo vende en los alrededores de la comunidad, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que todo lo que produce es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es bueno; María es una mujer luchadora, siempre dispuesta a trabajar para salir adelante, esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abra camino al éxito, en la ultimo temporada de siembra tuvo perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita invertir en insumos como semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. María Elena tiene buen record de crédito y buenas referencia de paga, aseguró q podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Maria Elena is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her grandchildren.  She grows beans and corn and has various years experience in agriculture and has developed sufficient experience to obtain better earnings.   The land she farms on is located on an agricultural zone, near her residence.  Everything she cultivates she sells around the neighborhood and she has a whole lot of customers because they know she produces prime quality products and has affordable prices, aside from outstanding service.  Maria has a fighting spirit, always ready to work in order to get ahead and she is expects new opportunities to open up the door for success.  Last season she incurred losses to her crops and would like to recuperate which is why she is soliciting a loan to INTEGRAL.  The loan would allow her to invest it towards consumables like: bean and corn seed, fertilizer, insecticides, tools, etc.. Maria Elena has great credit history and good payment history as well.  She assures that she will be able to liquidate her debt and at the same time be able to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bean and corn seed, fertilizer, insecticides, and tools.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa es una mujer de 53, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, amable y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por tener la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero gracias al apoyo de sus hijos sueña con poder hacerlo pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y  películas en la televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Pallares para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Narcisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de chicha de jora, desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor preparando esta riquísima bebida, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas; adicionalmente Narcisa se dedica  a la agricultura en un pequeño terreno con el que cuenta.
Narcisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso y techar parte de su casa con calaminas; de esta manera Narcisa tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones y podrá brinda mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 53, lives in the city of Camana with her husband and three children. She is a hardworking, friendly and enthusiastic woman. With her husband, she devotes all of her efforts to raise her family. Unfortunately she needed to start work at a young age to support her parents, and was not able to finish primary school. However, thanks to the support of her children she dreams of being able to do so soon. In her spare time, Narcisa enjoys watching movies and educational programs on television, and sometimes cooks delicious Pallares to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Narcisa works every day in her small business selling chicha, a sweet Peruvian drink. She starts work early in the morning to prepare this delicious drink, and works for approximately 8 hours daily. Narcisa works in agriculture, and has a small plot of land. 

Narcisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to their assistance she will make improvements to her home. She wants to install corrugated metal sheets in the floor and roof of her house, to improve her home and provide greater security and prosperity for her family.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es: Miryam con su anterior credikiva, logró comprar en mayor cantidad insumos y materias primas con los que preparó un más amplio volumen de productos, como deditos, empanadas y pastelitos de carne, pollo y queso y venderlos; así mismo compró un molino eléctrico con el que ha logrado ser más efectiva en su producción. Su inventario es más variado que antes y tiene mas clientes y esto fue justamente el éxito de esta inversión. Ella está muy satisfecha y está nuevamente aplicando a un credikiva, porque comprará empaques en icopor para venderlos como productos congelados y mucha mas materias primas e insumos, con los cuales planea aumentar su producción y lograr aumentar una vez mas sus ventas. Su mensaje a los financiadoras de Kiva es el siguiente: “Con su apoyo estoy logrando realizar mis sueños, metas y objetivos trazados con la ayuda del núcleo familiar. Muchas gracias “
texts.en: Miryam used her previous Kiva loan to buy larger amounts of ingredients and raw materials that she used to produce larger volumes of baked goods like ‘deditos’ [ladyfingers], turnovers and meat, chicken and cheese pies to sell.  She also bought an electric mill that has made her production more efficient.  Her inventory is more varied than before and she has more customers which was precisely the success of this loan.  She is very satisfied and is applying for a new Kiva loan because she’ll buy more Styrofoam packaging to sell her items frozen and many more raw materials and supplies to increase production and once again increase sales.  Her message to Kiva lenders is: “With your support I’m reaching the dreams, goals and objectives drawn with help from the nuclear family.  Thank you very much.”

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 33ans, Mr Kokouvi est marié à une coiffeuse. 02 enfants sont à leur charge, âgés de 12 et 08ans, ils vont à l’école. Il est réparateur et revendeur de moulins dans une boutique depuis 1991. Cette activité lui procure des revenus lui permettant d’assurer le minimum vital à sa famille. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour s’acheter de la dynamo pour moulin. Il veut réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité, ouvrir d’autres boutiques plus tard et assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: A young man, 33 years old, Mr. Kokouvi is married to a hairdresser. He supports two children, aged 12 and 8 years old, who go to school. Mr. Kokouvi has been repairing and selling mills (grinders) in a store since 1991. This business will bring in the revenues enabling him to meet the vital needs of his family. To satisfy his customers further, he is requesting a second WAGES loan to buy a generator for his mills. He wants to reinvest the extra profits into the business, open another shop later on, and ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a generator for his mills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out maintenance and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Erivaldo

texts.es: Erivaldo de 42 años de edad  tiene una panadería en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar, su experiencia data desde hace 14 años, cuando aprendió el oficio de la mano de su hermano, lo perfeccionó cuando vivió en Bogotá,  la capital de Colombia y lo experimentó en su natal Puerto Colombia, cuando emprendió su propio negocio.  Erivaldo también trabajó en la tienda de su padre y esta  fue otra experiencia en el área comercial, que abonó el terreno para el montaje de su panadería. Con su producción  surte las tiendas del sector  pues su estilo empresarial es de distribución a intermediarios y planea mudarse a un local donde además pueda vender directamente al consumidor final.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una nueva vitrina, una nevera, materias primas e insumos para dar inicio a la meta de vender directamente a un público que lo reconoce. Su aspiración mas adelante es convertir su negocio en un autoservicio y aumentar el surtido de productos de la canasta familiar. Mientras esto ocurre, Erivalo trabaja persistentemente  para lograr el bienestar de su familia, que está conformada por su esposa y su hijo de 14 años de edad, con quien tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad en el marco de sus estudios para que a futuro se convierta en persona exitosa.
texts.en:
Erivaldo, 42, has a bakery in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, a place on the seashore.  He has 14 years’ experience having learned the occupation from his brother.  When he lived in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, he honed his skills and when he opened his own business in his birthplace, Puerto Colombia, he put them to use.  Erivaldo also worked in his father’s store and this was more commercial experience that helped him when it came time to open his bakery.  He supplies local stores with his production since his business style is to sell to middlemen; he plans, however, to move into a locale where he will be able to sell directly to the final consumer.

His Kiva loan is the first financing he’s had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he’ll use it to buy a new display case, a refrigerator, raw materials and supplies to start toward the goal of selling direct to the public that knows him.  His hope for later on is to turn his business into a self-serve and to increase the variety of basic staple items.  While this occurs, Erivaldo works persistently to attain wellbeing for his family which consists of his wife and 14-year-old son.  He has many dreams of prosperity for him framed by his schooling so that he will become a successful person.

loans.use: to buy a new display case, a refrigerator, raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession, Abla est mariée et mère d’01 enfant de 2ans et demi. Son activité se fait dans un atelier.
