En plus de la coiffure et pour permettre à ses clients de mieux se sentir dans ses services rendus, elle vend des mèches et perruques au même lieu. Elle voudrait acheter en gros et revendre à un prix convenable pouvant répondre aux désirs des clients, assurer la scolarité de sa fille. Avec ce second prêt, elle va s’acheter des mèches.
texts.en: A hairdresser by profession, Abla is married and has one child who is two and a half years old. She provides services in a workshop. As well as hairdressing and to help her customers feel good about the service they receive, she sells extensions and wigs at the same location. Abla would like to buy at wholesale and sell for a suitable price that would meet the clients' wishes and allow her to pay for her daughter's schooling. With this second loan, she will buy hair extensions.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
Shabani is in his late thirties, and he is married with five children who go to school.   He has two businesses.  He has been selling fresh fish and working as a food vendor for about ten years now.  He is really hard working.   He works from 9 a.m. to 11 p.m., and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Shabani’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   He used the previous loan to buy a deep freezer and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to open another fish business. His dream is to have more fish shops in different areas and to one day be able to build a big hotel.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Paradise, which totals 13 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Âgée de 57ans et mère de 02 enfants tous à l’école, Madame Dédé est mariée à un pasteur. Elle est enseignante et fondatrice d’école. C’est en 1990 qu’elle à crée son école et elle s’y plait bien car cela lui permet d’aider les élèves à devenir utile à la société. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour réaménager les toitures de son complexe scolaire. Elle voudrait à l’avenir  avoir une grande école de renom du primaire au lycée. Son problème est le retard dans le paiement des frais de scolarité.
texts.en:
Ms. Dédé, aged 57, is the mother of two children, both in school. She is married to a pastor and is a teacher and founder of a school. In 1990, she established her school, and she is very pleased with it because it allows her to help students to become useful in society. 

She is requesting this initial loan to refurbish the roofing of her educational complex. In the future, she would like to have a large school renowned for primary education through high school. The problem she has is the late payment of school fees.

loans.use: to refurbish the roofing of her educational complex

loans.name: Edy Wilder

texts.es:
Edy es una persona muy humilde, alegre y trabajador, él vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pareja y su pequeña hija, a quienes ama y son su principal razón para esforzarse y salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica que tanto quería, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su Padre, desde hace varios años Edy puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de tener una vulcanizadora, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana Edy inicia su labor arreglando y refaccionando llantas, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que pone en marcha las enseñanzas que su  Padre le enseño.
Edy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda bridada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas, tales como tercas, llaves, una gata, entre otros artículos; de esta manera Edy contará con los materiales necesarios para desempañarse en su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con ello espera incrementar sus ingresos económicos para poder asegurar la educación y el bienestar de su pequeña.
texts.en:
Edy’s a very humble, cheerful, hardworking person living in the city of Ica in Parcona District with his spouse and little girl who he loves very much and who are his main reason for striving to get ahead.  Unfortunately, because he needed to go to work and cover his expenses he was unable to study the career of mechanical engineering he so desired.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors and on occasion cooks a delicious “Cau Cau” to share with his family.

With much effort and enthusiasm and thanks to support from his father, Edy opened a small tire repair shop several years ago. Starting very early in the morning Edy works day to day repairing and patching tires.  He spends approximately 12 hours daily in his business and feels good doing his work because it puts into practice what his father taught him.

Edy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy tools like wrenches, nuts, a jack, among others so that Edy will have the necessary materials on hand to develop in his work and provide better customer service. He hopes with it to increase his income to insure his little girl’s education and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Amalia Felipa

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer de 47 años, vive con sus padres y su hijo en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, ella es una persona muy humilde, trabajadora amable y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente ella se separó de su esposo, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para su hijo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en la televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Amalia trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Amalia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de medicinas para su Madre, ya que lamentablemente ella padece una penosa enfermedad; de esta manera Amalia podrá contar con los medicamentos necesarios para brindar los cuidados que requiere su querida Madre.
texts.en:
Amalia is a 47-year-old woman living with her parents and her son in the city of Ica in Santiago District.  She’s a very humble, hardworking, kind and enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, she separated from her husband and since then has been both father and mother to her son.  In her free time she likes to watch educational and news programs on television and sometimes cooks some delicious “Tallarines Rojos” to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Amalia works day to day as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in her city.  She works approximately 10 hours daily and feels good doing her work.  She believes she does well because of her dedication and because of the kind way she treats others.

Amalia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy medicine for her mother who is suffering a grievous illness.  In this way, Amalia will be able to have the necessary medicine her mother’s care requires.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her mother.

loans.name: Yolanda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yolanda vive en la calurosa ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se puede apreciar atractivos turísticos como la laguna de “Huacachina, la cual se ubica en medio de maravillosas dunas, en las cuales se practican deportes de aventura como el samboarding, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva la uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros. Yolanda tiene 45 años de edad, pero es muy alegre y tiene un espíritu de una joven de 15 años ya que ella le gusta trabajar y lo hace con muchas ganas, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro inicio su negocio de venta de abarrotes en su vivienda, desde hace ya 2 años; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es mable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante.

Yolanda está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracia a la gran ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar al por mayor, fideos, conservas, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros; asi de esta manera ella mejorara sus ingresos y podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in the sunny city of Ica, known for its warmth and coziness. The city is also home to attractions such as the Huacachina lagoon, located amid spectacular dunes where adventure sports such as sandboarding are practiced. The area is also known for its agriculture, particularly grapes, asparagus and lima beans, among others. Yolanda is 45 years old, but she is very happy with the spirit of a 15 year old girl. She likes to work and is keen to do it. With great effort and savings, two years ago she started her business selling groceries from her home. Yolanda believes that her business is doing because it is friendly to her customers, and especially because of her strong desire to succeed.

Yolanda is very grateful for Kiva loans. Due to the great help they have given her, she can buy supplies for her business such as rice, wholesale sugar, noodles, canned food and soft drinks, among others. Through this, Yolanda will improve her revenue and be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, allowing her to continue fighting to achieve her greatest dream: "To own a minimarket."

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business (rice, wholesale sugar, noodles, canned food and soft drinks, among others)

loans.name: Choeun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Choeun is 36 years old and married with four children, only two of whom are dependent on him. The main sources of his family’s income are rice farming and pineapple planting which he has been doing for almost ten years. He can earn about 23,000KHR per day.

This will be the third loan for Choeun’s group of three members, the previous two totally repaid. Choeun used the first loan to improve his livelihood, and will use this new one to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to set aside some money to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en: Cosmas runs a transport business for a living. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to buy a motorbike for his transport business. This helped his business to improve, as the number of his customers increased. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: San Martin - Izcuchaca Group

texts.es:
Hola, Buenos días! saludos de todos los peruanos. Hoy les presento al grupo de San Martin - Izcuchaca”
Un grupo que lleva más de 1 año trabajando junto al Grupo Edaprospo, se formaron este grupo porque todos trabajan dentro de la misma localidad todos son trabajadores independientes, que tiene el sueño de mejorar sus ingresos, y así mejorar también su forma de vida en sus hogares.
Una de las socias de este grupo es Maritza, de 37 años de edad, que apoya a su esposo en la mantención de la familia con los ingresos que obtiene con las ventas que obtiene en su restaurant.
Ella vive con su esposo, y sus dos hijas, la primera estudia en un Instituto Público, y la segunda en etapa escolar, La mayor ayuda a su mamá en el negocio en sus tiempos libres y cuando está de vacaciones.
El sueño de Maritza es darles a sus dos hijas con una profesión, para que ellas puedan vivir de los ingresos de su profesión. 
El préstamo que solicita Maritza es para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, por cantidad, para que pueda tener mayor utilidad en sus ingresos 
Maritza está muy feliz, al saber que personas extranjeras la ayudan a ella como a su grupo a llevar adelante sus sueños, es por eso que nos dice: Gracias, por el apoyo a EDAPROSPO y a los inversionistas de KIVA.
Maritza está vestida con una chompa con combinaciones en negro y blanco, pantalón marrón, y lleva una pequeña cartera tejida en negro y blanco, es la tercera de la derecha. 
*En la parte superior esta la fotografía de Lucia.
texts.en:
Hello, Good Morning!  Greetings from Perú.  

Today I’d like to present the “San Martín-Ixcuchaca” group to you, a group that’s been working with Edaprospo Group for a year.  They joined together because they all worked in the same locality and all work as independent workers who dream with improving their income and thus also improve their way of life at home.

One of this group’s members is Maritza, 37, who helps her husband support the family with income she earns from sales in her restaurant.  She lives with her husband and two daughters.  The older one attends public school and the second one is school age.  The older one helps her mother in the business in her free time and when she’s on school vacation.  Maritza’s dream is to provide her two daughters with professions so that they can support themselves from income earned from their professions.

The loan Maritza is requesting is to buy groceries like rice, sugar, noodles and oil in quantity in order to have higher profits from her income.  Maritza is very happy to know that foreigners help her and her group to carry out their dreams which is why she says: “Thank you for the support from Edaprospo and from Kiva lenders.”

Maritza is wearing a black and White sweater, Brown pants and is carrying a small, knit, black and white purse; she’s third from the right.

*Lucía’s photo appears at the top of the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ocoña con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos; ella es una persona muy humilde, amable y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas en compañía de sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Sofía trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde se dedica a la agricultura, ella trabaja un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor.
Sofía se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos; de esta manera ella espera que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente, para así cuando culmine su cosecha, espera poder vender lo suficiente para incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco utilizará para la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Sofía, 33, lives in the city of Ocoña with her partner and their two small children. She is very humble, kind and hardworking, and is devoted to raising her family. Unfortunately, she needed to work from a young age to support her parents and could not consider a career, but she would have liked to do so. In his spare time Sofía likes to watch movies with her little ones, and sometimes cooks a delicious shrimp chowder to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Sofía works daily as an agricultural laborer on a farm in her city. She also has a small field of her own which she farms. She works approximately 12 hours per day and enjoys her work.

Sofía is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to their assistance she will be able to purchase manure and fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that her crops will develop properly so that at harvest time she will be able to sell enough to increase their income, which little by little will be used for the education and welfare of her children.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Con su anterior crédito Fredy compró una máquina industrial y materias primas e insumos. Con esa nueva inversión, Fredy dio un paso adelante,  porque mejoró los tiempos productivos, aumentó la calidad de los bolsos y calzados que fábrica y su capacidad de compra en volumen, disminuyendo los costos  e incrementando sus ventas. En la actualidad planea acceder a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen hebillas, pegantes y cuero, con lo cual planea producir nuevos diseños y hacer su mejor venta del año. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Les estoy agradeciendo el apoyo para continuar con el crecimiento y desarrollo de mi negocio.“
texts.en: Fredy used his previous loan to buy an industrial machine, raw materials and supplies.  With this new investment, Fredy took a step forward because he improved production time, increased the quality of the purses and shoes he manufactures and his capacity for volume purchases lowering his costs and increasing sales.  He currently plans to access a new Kiva loan to buy larger amounts of buckles, glue and leather he plans to use to produce new designs and to have the best yearly sales.  His message to Kiva lenders is: “I am very grateful to you for the support to continue growing and developing my business.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and to clear weeds from the fields.

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Madame FATOU BINTOU est une femme mariée qui habite au SENEGAL. Elle s’active depuis plus de cinq ans dans le secteur du commerce, aussi bien dans la vente  d’huile de palme et de produits locaux que dans   la commercialisation de produits cosmétiques comme activité secondaire dans la localité ou elle habite. Elle a en charges trois enfants dont l’âge varie entre un et huit ans. Elle a déjà remboursé cinq crédits antérieurs à l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un prêt de 50000FCFA  prévu pour l’achat d’huile de palme et de   produits locaux en vue de renforcer son stock. Son objectif  est de satisfaire la demande accrue de ses clients  mais aussi  accroitre ses bénéfices pour  mieux assister sa famille. Elle envisage de  constituer une épargne personnelle. Son projet futur consiste à acquérir un grand magasin ou elle pourra stocker ses produits.
texts.en:
Mrs. FATOU BINTOU is a married woman who lives in SENEGAL. She has been working in trade for over five years, selling palm oil and local products. 

As a secondary activity, she also sells cosmetic products in her neighborhood. She has three dependent children ages 1 to 8. She has already obtained and repaid five previous loans with U-IMCEC.

She is seeking a loan of 50,000 FCFA to buy palm oil and local products to strengthen her stock. Her goals are to meet customer demand and to bolster her profits to better provide for her family. 

She plans to start saving, and in the long term, she also wants to acquire a large commercial space to store her merchandise.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Djarena

texts.fr: Revendeuse des produits génériques et de beauté de façon ambulante, madame djarena est une jeune dame de 34ans. Son conjoint est sous-marin et ils ont 02 enfants en charge qui vont à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 08 et 05ans. C’est en 2008 qu’elle a démarré l’activité et cela l’aide à prendre soin d’elle et de sa famille. Avec ce prêt qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, elle va s’acheter des produits génériques et de beauté au Grand marché de Lomé. Elle voudrait investir dans son activité, en ouvrant une boutique afin de mieux prendre soin de ses clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
A street trader of generic products and beauty products, Djarena is a young 34 year old woman. Her spouse is a submarine operator and they have 2 dependent children who go to school. They are 8 and 5 years old. It was in 2008 that she started her business and this helps her to take care of herself and her family.

With the loan she is requesting from our institution, she is going to buy herself generic products and beauty products at the Grand Market in Lomé. She would like to invest in her business, by opening a shop in order to better take care of her clients. As for future prospects, she wants to see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy generic products and beauty products.

loans.name: Veronica Amalia

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos; ella es una persona muy humilde, amable y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas en compañía de sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Saltado de Carne para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Verónica trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde se dedica a la agricultura, ella trabaja un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor.
Verónica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos; de esta manera Verónica espera que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente, para así cuando culmine su cosecha, espera poder vender lo suficiente para incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco utilizará para la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 36-year-old woman living in the city of Camaná with her spouse and two small children.  She’s a very humble, kind, hardworking person who dedicated all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, because she needed to work since she was very young to support her parents, she was unable to study a professional career but would have liked to do so very much.  In her free time she enjoys watching movies with her little ones and sometimes cooks a delicious “Saltado de Carne” to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Verónica works day to day as a field hand on a large agricultural estate.  She also has a small parcel of land where she works in agriculture.  She works about 12 hours daily and feels good doing her work.

Verónica is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will buy manure and fertilizer for her crop.  She hopes to sell enough to increase her income that she’ll gradually use for her children’s education and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesus Enrique

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre de 35 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, él es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajador, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; con mucho empeño culmino sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos.
Por iniciativa propia y con mucho empeño, Jesús puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de elaboración de estructuras metálicas, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por sus buenos acabados y por su buena atención.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios  Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas para su negocio, tales como: un soplete, una cierra, pintura acrílica, un soldador, entre otros; de esta manera Jesús tendrá su negocio acondicionado con los materiales necesarios para realizar su labor, así el espera poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea utilizar para poder adquirir una mototaxi para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 35-year-old man living in the city of Camaná.  He’s a very kind, enthusiastic, hardworking person who focuses all his efforts in getting ahead.  He completed secondary school with much dedication.  Unfortunately, because he needed to go to work to cover his expenses he wasn’t able to study a professional career but would have liked to have done so.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with friends and neighbors.

On his own initiative and with much dedication, Jesús opened a small business manufacturing metallic structures.  He starts work every day very early and spends about 12 hours per day.  He believes he does well because of the good work he does and the good service he provides.

Jesús is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy work tools like a blowtorch, a saw, acrylic paint, a welding machine, among others so that Jesús will have a business equipped with the necessary tools to do the work. He expects thus to increase his income which in the not too distant future he plans to use to buy a mototaxi to put to work.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sangke district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Phally, 51, is a married mother of three children who have their own employment. The source of her family’s income is from farming on a five-hectare area of farmland, where she grows rice, soybean, and cassava. She and her husband have been in this business for several years. The main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of working capital.

This is Phally's second loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She successfully used the first loan to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase her family’s income. Now she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future. With the need to support her business, she is requesting another loan of 1,000 USD with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy seeds for her farmland, as well as use a portion of it for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, age 52, sells clothes to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. She has a favorable environment for her business and has gained many customers. She is also engaged in livestock farming to earn additional income. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Petronila dreams of expanding her business and employing people to help her in the future. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES in order to buy clothes and bags to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Умеда родилась в городе Исфара. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее двое маленьких детей. Умеда занималась торговлей четыре года. Она работала продавщицей в частном магазине. На сегодняшний день Умеда арендовала не большое помещение для магазина. Она хочет заняться торговлей тканей и открыть собственный магазин. Умеда имеет неплохой опыт в этой сфере. 
Умеда просит кредит для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Umeda was born in the city of Isfara.  She is 34 years old, married and has two small children.  Umeda had been involved in sales for four years.  She used to work as a salesperson at a private store.  Today, Umeda leased a small space for a store.  She wants to get involved in selling fabrics and open her own store.  Umeda has a good experience in this field.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо женщина в возрасте 45 лет.Она занимается откормом скота в течении 4 лет.Заниматься  этим видом деятельности ее научил муж. В данное время ее муж находится в Российской федерации на заработках.Ей приходиться одной откармливать скот и даже продавать на рынке потому что у нее шестеро детей и она должна кормить и обучать их.Ее дети как могут помогают матери. Мехринисо на полученный  кредит хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Mehriniso is a 45 year-old woman.  She has been involved in fattening up livestock for four years.  Her husband taught her this business.  Currently, her husband is in the Russian Federation for work.  Mehriniso has to feed and even sell the livestock by herself because she has six children, whom she needs to feed and educate.  Her children help their mother as they can.  Mehriniso wants to use this loan to increase the livestock headcount and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Amil, age 27, and his wife Ragsana earn their living through an agricultural business. They live in a small village of Gardabani District. They have two milking cows and five calves. Ragsana milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese, part of which is used by the family; the rest is sold locally. They also own a plot of land, where they grow broom. Amil sells the broom in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris.  

Amil has requested a loan to be used toward cultivation of his agricultural land. After cultivation, he plans to sow more broom there. Amil and Ragsana will work hard on their plot in order to obtain a good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. As a result of this Kiva loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Amil is grateful for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate his land

loans.name: Mutiso

texts.en:
Mutiso, age 60, practices livestock farming to earn his living. He has been engaged in this business for 30 years. He and his wife have raised six children. 

Mutiso has already received and repaid a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to improve his business. He has also learned the importance of saving through the business trainings he has attended. 

Mutiso dreams of building a permanent house in the future. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES in order to buy one cow and five goats.

loans.use: to buy one cow and five goats

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter, age 55, is engaged in an agricultural business to earn a living. She has a plot of land where she grows plums, pomegranates, cherries, and persimmons. She sells her harvested produce on the local open market. 

Eter lives in a small village in Gardabani District with her son Spartak, her daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren, ages two and six. The elder grandchild studies in the village school and the younger goes to kindergarten. Eter's son works in construction and receives a service fee for his work. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Eter has requested a loan in order to purchase milk cows. With these, she will be able to produce cheese, which she will sell on the local open market. In this way, she intends to expand her agricultural business in order to it make more profitable. With the increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her business as well as to be able to better provide for the family’s daily needs and complete essential renovations to the house. As a result, Eter will be able to give offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred, age 28, operates a barber shop to earn a living. He started the business in 2011 and has one employee. He and his wife have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned the importance of saving, since he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. 

Wilfred has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES in order to buy a shaving machine and a generator.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine and a generator

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar, age 43, and his wife Sabina run an agricultural business to earn a living. They have two milk cows and produce cheese, part of which is used by the family; the rest is sold on the local open market. Ilgar lives in a small village in Gardabani District with his wife, their 19-year-old son, and his mother, who is a pensioner. His son is unemployed. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.
 
Ilgar has requested a loan in order to purchase calves, which he will raise and eventually sell at a profit. He will reinvest his additional earnings back into his agricultural enterprise in order to expand it and to make it more profitable, thereby improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 64 года, замужем,  имеет 4 детей. В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Анара начала свой бизнес в торговле со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день, в ее товарообороте имеется около 50,000 сом,  ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента за счет закупа мыла, порошка, шампуней и кремов. В будущем, Анара хочет увеличить свой бизнес и расширить магазин.
texts.en: Anara is 64 years old, married and has four children.  In search of a source of income for the family, she started her own business in sales in 2009 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and tenacity, today she has about 50,000 som in goods turnover, and her monthly profit amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Anara requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise selection by buying soap, detergent, shampoo and lotions.  In the future, she wants to expand her business and her store.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Niginakhon

texts.ru: Нигинахон жительница города Исфара. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сама Нигинахон занимается изготовлением и торговлей сито различных размеров. Этим видом деятельности Нигинахон занимается 11 лет. Нигинахон просит кредит для покупки материалов. Она привозит материалы из города Худжанд.
texts.en: Niginakhon is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 28 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband left to work in the Russian Federation.  Niginakhon is involved in making and selling strainers of various size.  She has been in this business for 11 years.  Niginakhon is requesting this loan to purchase materials.  She brings in materials from the city of Khujand.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Madame SALIMATA est une commerçante qui habite au SENEGAL. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10ans dans la vente de jus,  de crème et de glace. Son activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq enfants âges entre cinq et quatorze ans. Elle a déjà eu à rembourser un prêt à l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un  crédit de 200000FCFA qui servira à l’achat d’un autre réfrigérateur  pour l’élargissement de son activité de commerce qui lui procure ses revenus. Dans le futur, elle compte se lancer dans le commerce de tissus qui est une activité très enrichissante dans sa localité.
texts.en:
Ms. SALIMATA is a merchant who lives in Senegal. She has been active for over ten years in selling juices, cream, and ice. Her business enables her to meet the needs of her five children, 5 to 14 years old. 

She has already repaid a loan with the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA for buying another refrigerator to enlarge her business, which brings in revenues. In the future, she plans to start up a business selling fabrics, which is a very lucrative business in her town.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Eleazer

texts.en:
Eleazar, age 42, is a farmer. He supports his wife and child in a rural community. He plants rice, vegetables, and root crops, which he harvests and offers for sale. His primary goal is to become more financially stable so that he can meet his family's needs and offer his child a brighter future. To generate additional income, Eleazar has set up a small variety store for his wife to operate in front of their house.  
 
Eleazar and his wife would like to improve the variety of inventory in the store, but they have insufficient capital to do so. This is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of P10,000.00, which he will use to buy snack food items, canned goods, bar soap, breads, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to offer for sale. 
 
Eleazar is confident that this loan will help him to improve the business, allowing it to develop into a consistent and viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy snack food items, canned goods, bar soap, breads, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to offer for sale

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru: Савринисо студентка 3 курса. Она учится в Таджикском  Государственном Университете Права и Бизнеса в факультете Дипломатия. Она учится на отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Савринисо является секретарем студенческого Совета, а также получает стипендию. В будущем она хочет стать посолом. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора в 2012-2013 учебного года. Так как ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу Савринисо, Вы являетесь единственными людьми, кто может подержать ее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Savriniso is a third-year student.  She is studying Diplomacy at the Tajikistan State University of Law and Business.  She is an excellent student and is actively involved in the university's public life.  Savriniso is a secretary of the student union and also receives a stipend.  In the future, she wants to become an ambassador.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to pay for her education contract for the 2012-2013 school year.  Because her parents are unable to pay for Savriniso's education, you are the only people, who can support her.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university education

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Gerald is in his early 30s. He is married with three children, one of which is still going to school. He has been running a radio retail shop for about two years now. He is really hardworking. He works from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m., and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   He used the previous loan to build a small house in his village, buy a sofa set, and a TV and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more radios to sell.  Gerald's dream is to one day be an international businessman.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Lotus, which totals 11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more radios to sell

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Madame PENDA est une femme mariée qui vit au SENEGAL. Elle commercialise des tissus, et pratique  en même temps  la vente de poissons depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle est soutien de famille et a en charges quatre enfants âges entre sept et quatorze ans. Elle a eu à rembourser un crédit à l’U-IMCEC. Son objectif  majeur est le renforcement de son fond de roulement ce qui pourra l’aider à développer davantage son activité de commerce. Par conséquent, elle sollicite un prêt de 200000FCFA  qui servira à l’achat de tissus à revendre, ainsi elle pourra répondre à la demande de sa fidèle clientèle en cette veille de fête.
texts.en:
Ms. PENDA is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She sells fabrics and, at the same time, she has been selling fish for over five years. She is the breadwinner in her family and supports four children, 7 to 14 years old. 

She has repaid a loan with the microfinance institution U-IMCEC. Her major goal is to bolster her working capital. This will help her to develop her business further. Consequently, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA for buying fabrics to resell. Thus she will be able to respond to the demands of her loyal customer base ahead of the holiday.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to resell

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Madame MATY est une femme mariée âgée de plus d’une soixantaine d’année qui vit dans une des localités villageoises du SÉNÉGAL. Elle a pendant longtemps évolué   dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de petit déjeuner où  elle a acquiert une expérience de plus d’une vingtaine d’années. Les bénéfices que lui procurait son activité lui ont toujours permis de gérer ses besoins personnels et d’assister  sa famille dans leurs besoins quotidiens. Actuellement compte tenue de son âge avancé, elle s’est orientée dans l’immobilier. Par conséquent, elle sollicite un prêt de 100000FCFA, montant qui lui   permettra de terminer la réfection d’une partie de sa maison à mettre en location. Les revenus que lui procurera son investissement   lui permettront de continuer à se prendre en charge. Son projet futur est d’avoir un grand immeuble à usage de location qui lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. MATY is a married woman, 60+ years old, who lives in a village in Senegal. For a long time, she has been working in commerce, that is, selling breakfasts. She has over twenty years of experience in this business. The profits she used to earn from her business has always allowed her to manage her personal needs and to help her family members with their day-to-day needs. 

Currently, given her advanced age, she has turned toward rental property. Consequently she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA, an amount enabling her to complete repairs on part of her house to be rented out. The revenues to be gotten from her investment will enable her to continue to support herself. Her future plans include having a large building to rent out enabling her to grow her profits.

loans.use: to complete repairs on part of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and clean his coffee fields.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela tiene una gran experiencia como confeccionista que data desde el año 1990, la cual en el año 2000, tradujo en una actividad generadora de ingresos, con la que había soñado y en la que hoy ha logrado  fortalecer su autonomía. Estela habita en una urbanización caracterizada por combinar perfectamente viviendas familiares, con espacios productivos formales e informales,  con el sector financiero e infraestructuras recreativas muy importantes para su comunidad,  porque son espacios    infantiles y juveniles donde concurren en su tiempo ocioso para practicar actividades lúdicas y deportivas, a rededor de uno de los escenarios deportivos mas importantes del país como el  Estadio Metropolitano, cuna de artífices del balompié nacional.  Este es el ambiente en el cual Estela y su esposo sueñan con ver crecer a su hijo de 15 años, como un profesional exitoso y donde ella tiene un taller de confecciones  de ropa con el cual apoya el bienestar de esta familia. Estela fabrica vestidos femeninos, que vende en los almacenes que están ubicados a su alrededor, ropa de jeanes y también fabrica los uniformes de varias empresas; aunque la competencia en su entorno es alta, ella se sostiene con la calidad de su producto y con la capacidad de servir, que pone a disposición de sus clientes. Su meta es tener un mayor espacio para su taller, pero su mayor desafío es lograr tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para aumentar su inversión, incrementar su clientela y ganar cada vez más dinero. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará  materias primas al por mayor y de contado, debido a que las ventas se incrementan en el segundo semestre del año y ella necesita estar preparada para hacer una buena venta basada en productos a un buen precio y con el diseño requerido por la clientela en esta temporada del año.
texts.en: Estela has a lot of experience and has worked as a seamstress since 1990.  She turned that experience into a business in 2000, turning her dreams into a basis for her independence today.  Estela lives in an urban area that combines family homes and both formal and informal work spaces perfectly.  The financial sector and recreational infrastructure are both important to the community because they are spaces where children and teenagers spend their leisure time on sports and play around one of the biggest sports stadiums in the country, the Estadio Metropolitano - the national cradle of soccer.  This is the environment where Estela and her husband dream of seeing their 15-year-old son grow up to be a successful professional and where she has her sewing workshop for making the clothing which supports the family's well-being.  Estela makes dresses that she sells in the local stores, jeans, and also uniforms for various businesses.  Although the competition in her area is steep, she maintains herself with the quality of her product and with her customer service which pleases her customers.  Her goal is to have a bigger space for her workshop but her biggest challenge is to manage to have enough working capital to increase her investment, increase her clientele, and earn more money.  This is why she turned to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, which she will use to buy basic materials at wholesale and cash prices.  Due to the sales increases in the second half of the year, she needs to be prepared to make good sales based on having products at a good price and with the designs her customers want during this season.

loans.use: to buy basic materials at wholesale and cash prices.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 55 years old and married. She lives in a small village in the Gardabani District with her husband, Gocha, and their two sons who are six and 26 years old. The younger son goes to school, while the elder and Gocha earn an income working in construction.

Irma runs a small dairy farm with three milk cows. She milks the cows twice a day and makes cheese. Parts of the milk and cheese are for family members, and the rest is sold on the local open market. The family works hard but still can’t make enough money to put into savings.

Irma is applying for a loan to buy additional milk cows. With them she will get more milk to sell, increase her cheese production and so grow the family’s income. With the increase, she will be able to reinvest in the dairy and make it more profitable.

Irma also will be able to buy more household goods and renovate the house. In this way living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to buy additional milk cows.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa, aged 52, is very responsible in generating income for her family. She runs a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village, operating from as early as 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. each day, earning about P300 daily.

Jesusa, who aims to improve her sales capacity and profits, is requesting a loan of P19,000 to buy canned goods, breads, eggs and soft drinks to sell in her store. The additional goods will enable her to meet customer demand for quality products delivered with friendly service. Jesusa hopes to become a succesful entreprenuer in retailing.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, eggs and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi a 46 ans et vit à Lomé. Kayi a commencé il y a 30 ans son commerce de vente de tissus. Son activité nécessite un stock important pour satisfaire les exigences diverses de ses clients. C'est dans ce but que Kayi sollicite son deuxième crédit auprès de Wages. Elle a pour projet d'épargner les bénéfices que dégagera son activité grâce à ce prêt. Kayi espère qu'elle pourra un jour louer une boutique pour vendre en gros ses pagnes et ses tissus.
texts.en: Kayi is 46 years old and lives in Lomé. She started a business selling fabrics thirty years ago. Her business requires a significant inventory to satisfy the diverse requirements of her customers. With this goal, Kayi is requesting her second loan from WAGES. Her plans include saving the profits to be earned from her business, thanks to this loan. Kayi hopes she will be able to lease a shop one day in order to sell 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and fabrics in bulk.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza, 48, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. Her husband, Edigario, is a fish vendor. Together with her husband she manages the household while working.

Esperanza operates a sari-sari. In the Philippines, this is basically a small convenience store that offers groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies wholesale and selling them by the piece. She also sells charcoal.

Esperanza’s sari-sari is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, Esperanza is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan from CCT. She will be using it to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for tuning up her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her income as she grows her business.

All CCT community clients, and so Esperanza, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to expand her store's inventory.

loans.name: Japar

texts.en:
Japar is 30 years old. He is married and lives in a small village of Gardabani District with his big family: his wife, Amia, and his parents, brother, and sister-in-law. His brother offers a taxi service to the local population using his own car. Other family members are busy with an agricultural business. 

They have a plot of land where greens are grown. They sell the greens on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris, which is hardly enough for food and other household expenses for six members of the family.

Japar requested a loan for purchasing a car. He will offer a taxi service to the local population using his own car, like his brother. Thus, the family will get additional income. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car so he can offer a taxi service.

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Edem est une veuve de 56 ans, elle est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale sur étaage dans un marché de la place. Son activité nécessite un stock important pour satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est dans ce but qu'elle sollicite un crédit chez WAGES. Elle compte épargner les profits qu'elle réalisera. Edem espère un jour pouvoir devenir grossiste dans le but d'avoir un bon niveau de vie.
texts.en: Edem is a 56-year-old widow and a retailer of grocery items, which are displayed at a local market. Her business requires significant inventory to satisfy her customers. With this goal, she is requesting a loan from WAGES. She plans to save the profits she will earn. Edem hopes to become a wholesaler one day with the aim of having a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Yawoa

texts.fr: Yawoa a 40 ans, elle habite à Lomé avec son enfant de 3 ans. Yawoa exerce la profession de ménagère depuis l'année dernière. Son activité principale est le service traiteur. Yaowa sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages dans le but d'augmenter son stock en produit d'alimentation générale. Elle compte épargner les profits qu'elle réalisera grâce à ce crédit. Yawoa espère que son activité pour le moment ambulant se développera assez pour lui permettre d'ouvrir un grand bar.
texts.en: Yawoa is 40 years old and lives in Lomé with her 3-year-old child. Yawoa has been a homemaker over the last year. Her main work is in catering. She is requesting a loan from WAGES with the goal of increasing her inventory of food supplies. She plans on saving the profits to be earned thanks to this loan. Yawoa hopes that her business, currently operating door to door, will be developed enough to enable her to open a large bar.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her food service

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, seven of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin and mother).

For the last 8 years, Kasifa has sold Cavendish bananas at the market, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Kasifa's major business challenges are transportation and the fluctuating prices of Cavendish bananas. Her major goal and hope is to build her own house so that she could work from there. Kasifa lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas for resale

loans.name: Khumai

texts.en:
Khumai is 45 years old. She lives in a small village in Marneuli District with her 15-year-old son, Talekh. They earn their living through their agricultural business. They have three milking cows and two calves. They produce dairy foods: cheese, curds and yogurt, and sell them on the local open market. Khumai also owns a plot of land, where broom is grown. The family's total average monthly income is 400 Laris.

Khumai has requested a loan to purchase building materials to build a greenhouse. When it will be built, Khumai will sow greens and vegetables there. She will work hard on the plot to get a good harvest and will sell the harvested products on the local open market for a good price. This will enable her to increase her agricultural business and, accordingly, her income. As a result of the above mentioned activities, Khumai and Talekh will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan for 25,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julita hopes to grow her business more in the coming years and to help her family members who are in need. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
For the past two years Jane, a mother of two children, has run a cereals shop to earn a living. She sells maize, beans and rice in a busy neighborhood with reliable customers. Jane has hired an employee to help her out. She also farms to make more money.

Jane is a new member of Faulu Kenya. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more maize and beans. Jane hopes that her business will grow and she will be able to employ more people.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans.

loans.name: Proeurn

texts.en:
Proeurn, 41 years old, is married and lives in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. He is responsible for five single children, three of whom are employed. His first and second child work on a rubber plantation in the province and his third child sells sugar cane juice in a public gathering place.

Proeurn has worked in the construction industry for many years to support his living needs. Most of his income goes for food and allowances for his two school-aged children. His business challenge is when there aren't any customer orders and he is unable to make profit for his family. For this reason, Proeurn wants to create a business for his free time, so that he can generate additional income for his family. He aims to make red sugar from palm juice but lacks start up capital for his new business. Proeurn is asking for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase firewood, a long ladder for climbing palm trees and different kinds of wooden containers for loading the palm juice. He hopes that lenders will support him and provide him with the opportunity to start up his new business, so that he can raise more income to satisfy his basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for cooking palm sugar, a long ladder for climbing palm trees and wooden containers for the palm juice

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune papa de 26ans, Mr Komlan est marié à une hôtelière et ils ont 01 enfant âgé de 07ans qui va à l’école. Pour bien jouer son rôle de père de famille il a commencé par vendre en 2007 de façon ambulante des cartes de recharges et des kits de connexion. Ils sont souvent confrontés à certains problèmes comme achat à crédit des marchandises et manque de clients par moment. Margé toutes ses difficultés, il ne se décourage pas et il demande un prêt à WAGES pour s’acheter des marchandises (kit de connexion et cartes de recharges) chez les grossistes. Il voudrait devenir un distributeur agrée des cartes de recharges, des kits de connexion et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
A young 26 year old father, Komlan is married to a hotelkeeper and they have one 7-year old child who goes to school. To fulfill his role of father well in 2007 he started selling mobile phone recharge cards and connection kits as a street trader. He is often confronted by certain problems such as merchandise purchased by credit and lack of clients once in a while. 

Despite all his difficulties, he does not get discouraged and he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy merchandise (connection kits and mobile phone recharge cards) at the wholesalers. He would like to become a recognized distributor of mobile phone recharge cards and connection kits and ensure the self-fulfillment of his family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards and connection kits.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old and has four school-age children. She sells dried fish and fish sauce in the local market to earn an income.

Gloria and her husband want to continue sending their children to school and earn degrees so as to find good jobs someday. Despite financial difficulties, they are determined to pursue their plans, for they believe that nothing is impossible for one who has faith and determination.

In this regard, Gloria is aiming to improve her business and make it a viable source of income. But because of a lack of money she is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve her business and someday achieve the family’s goals.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Miladis Carolina

texts.es: Miladis Carolina de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y posee experiencia valiosa que le permite mejorar cada día mas su trabajo y obtener las mejores cosechas para la venta, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre tienen lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Miladis es una mujer entregada a su labor, enérgica y con muchos sueños que desea alcanzar, piensa que para complementar  una gran carrera hay que empezar por pequeños pasos, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital para la inversión en insumos, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, etc. Miladis tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Miladis Carolina is 29 years old and lives with her parents. She makes a living growing corn and beans. She has several years experience in agricultural work and possesses worthwhile experience that allows her to improve each day at work and receive better harvests to sell. The land where she grows is located in a zone with a lot of farming and very close to her house. She sells in all of the outskirts of her community and has many customers that prefer her because she always has what they need for quality products and at affordable prices. In addition, her service is excellent. 

Miladis is a woman who is very involved in her work, energetic and has many dreams that she hopes to achieve. She believes that to have a great career she must begin with small steps. During this planting season she wants to increase her production but does not have enough capital to invest in her supplies. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Integral that allows her to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, etc. Miladis has good payment references and assures that she will be able to make her payments and at the same time give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

She sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She also gets additional income through rearing poultry and pigs. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms, and also to become a wholesaler. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Modesta, who is in her late 20s, is married with three children and two of them go to school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more stock of food in order to sell to more people.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Modesta will share this loan with her loan group "Machimbo" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food to sell to more people.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives with her two kids within the local community of San Marcos Cabarroguis. She has involved herself in a livestock business for three years. She currently is raising two piglets. Aside from the livestock business, she also owns a transportation business, particularly a motorcycle transport. Diana feels very happy since her profits are able to provide for her children's needs. For now her greatest hope is to gain more income since her kids are growing up.

Diana would like to take out a loan of 25,000 PHP allowing her to buy hog feed and vaccines for her raised hogs. She hopes to obtain this loan amount in order to have a better way of living and send her children into higher levels of education.

Diana prays that God will give her the strength and the means to reach her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines for raising hogs

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a hardworking mother who sells ukay-ukay (used clothes) in the market. This is her way of helping her husband to generate income. She is now 49 years old and has thee school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, they need to increase their income to cover necessities and finance the education of their children. She plans to acquire more goods to sell, but she has inadequate capital. Rhoda is requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy pants, jackets, blouses, T-shirts, short pants, polo shirts and underwear to sell. She believes this financial assistance will help her to work out her plan. She is hoping that she will be successful in carrying it out.

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets, blouses, T-shirts, short pants, polo shirts and underwear to sell

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Perú. Les presentamos a la Alcancía Comunal “Arco Iris” es un grupo  conformado por  12  socios  que en su gran mayoría se dedican   la producción y venta de lácteos como queso y leche  que por medio de sus negocios  generan ingresos para sus familias. En esta oportunidad conocerán más sobre nuestra socia Narcisa.
La señora Narcisa se dedica a la venta de quesos, negocio que lleva hace más de 10 años,  sus deseos de contar con un negocio propio y mejorar su economía fue que la motivo a emprender su propio negocio, como segunda actividad ofrece tamales la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente, dichos negocios le ha permitido mejorar apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Se siente feliz pues con su trabajo puede seguir apoyando a su madre la cual está a su cargo. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda pues solo es de madera. El crédito que solicito lo va destinar para su negocio comprando quesos y así entregar sus pedidos. Narcisa es separada y tiene 02 hijos independiente. Ella  agradece a los que hicieron posible este crédito, ya que le ayuda a cumplir sus metas. Narcisa se encuentra en el parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo azul y chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru. We introduce the Communal Bank "Arco Iris (Rainbow)," which is a group made ​​up of 12 members who work mostly in the production and sale of dairy products such as cheese and milk.  Through their businesses they generate income for their families. This time we will learn more about our partner Narcisa.

Narcisa sells cheese, a business that she has been doing over 10 years.  Her desire to have her own business and improve her economic situation was the reason to start her own business.  As a second activity she offers tamales that she sells door to door.  These businesses have allowed her to improve supporting her children with their studies. She is happy because her work can continue to support her mother who is in her care.

Narcisa's greatest desire is to finish building her house because it is only wood. The requested loan is going to be allocated to her business by buying cheese to fulfill her orders. Narcisa is separated and has 2 independent children. She thanks those who made this loan possible, which helps her achieve her goals. In the photo, Narcisa is in the back row, the third from the right side wearing a blue polo shirt and grey vest.

loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and new coffee plants.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is a farmer who has been residing in Prey Chor district with her spouse and two children. She has been doing farming since she was a teenager living with her parents and now she is 31 years of age. Her husband works alongside her in the business. Together they typically generate approximately 18,000 KHR per day to cover their daily costs.

Due to insufficient capital to pay for the operating expenses of farming, Neang decided to take out a loan from Kiva through HKL to hire laborers for transplanting rice. This will help her to complete her farming tasks on time in the season and she hopes to have a plentiful harvest in this coming season.

loans.use: to hire laborers for transplanting rice

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a widow and has two kids. Despite her situation as the single bread winner of her family, she doesn't lose her hopes to succeed. It's been eight months ago from now when her spouse died due to a disease called Leptospirosis. She is really thankful to God because she is able to surpass those trials in her life.

Gemma has been a hog raiser within her village for three years. Everyday she enjoys feeding her raised pigs and cleaning their pig pen. Her dreams are to educate her two children and have additional pigs to raise. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders and ASKI for providing her the financial assistance she needed in making her business grow. She paid back her previous loan and asks for another loan amounting to 25,000 PHP. She will use this amount of loan in buying sacks of livestock feeds, vitamins and vaccines for proper growth of piglets. In this way, she could continually gain higher profits which will enable her provide all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of livestock feeds, vitamins and vaccines for proper growth of piglets

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old and single. She supports her mother who is old.

She has been in the business of selling school materials such as chalks and manila papers for two years now. Her monthly income is 4,000 KES. The loan will be used to buy manila papers and chalks for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay for her university education.

This is her first loan with KADET. Her hopes and dreams are to own a successful supply business.

loans.use: to buy chalks and manila papers

loans.name: Dora Sabina

texts.es:
Actualmente Dora reside en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo está ubicado entre la Sierra y Costa ecuatoriana haciéndole un enlace de varias carreteras ecuatorianas que conectan ciudades tales como Quito, Cuenca, Esmeraldas entre otras. Por lo tanto, es un punto importante del comercio ecuatoriano y cuenta con la mayoría del mercado ecuatoriano. La ciudad tiene un clima húmedo templado y su temperatura varía de 18°C a 28°C. Santo Domingo es hogar de los Tsáchilas, un grupo étnico que mantiene tradiciones tales como vestuario, idioma, y varias otras costumbres. 
Dora tiene 59 años y comenzó su negocio hace 18 años. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende comestibles entre otros productos. No es casada ni tiene hijos, por lo tanto dedica todo su tiempo a su pequeño emprendimiento. Ella trabaja casi todo el día en su tienda porque su sueño es que esta tiendita crezca. Por lo tanto, solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder agrandar su tienda, es decir para comprar más víveres de primera necesidad a mejor precio y con ello generar más ganancias y crecer como emprendedora.
texts.en:
Dora now lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas.  Santo Domingo is located between the mountains and the coast of Ecuador, making it a link between the various Ecuadorian highways that connect cities such as Quito, Cuenca, Esmeraldas, and others.  Therefore, it is an important Ecuadorian commercial center; it is home to most of the main Ecuadorian markets.  This city has a humid and temperate climate; the temperature varies between 18 and 28 degrees Centigrade.  Santo Domingo is home to the Tsachilas, an ethnic group that maintains its traditions such as: clothing, language and other customs.  

Dora is 59 years old, and she started her business 18 years ago.  She has a small store where she sells food and other products.  She is not married and has no children, so she devotes all of her time to her small business.  She works almost every day in her store, because her dream is to see it grow.  She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can expand her store by purchasing more products that are basic necessities at a better price.  With these products, she will generate more income and grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to expand her store with more merchandise

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with eight children and none of her children go to school. She does not take care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal and bananas at the market and from home. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She also gets additional income through making handcrafts like mats. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal, bunches of bananas, and materials for making crafts. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, bunches of bananas, and raw materials for making mats.

loans.name: Flor Viviana

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su amado esposo y su pequeño hijo, quien es su principal razón para salir adelante, ella es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajadora; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Flor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella asiste al mercado de su ciudad para realizar sus ventas de manera ambulatoria, labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y adicionalmente en las noches asiste al estadio de su distrito donde vende dulces y golosinas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su empeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Flor se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: chompas, sacos, pantalones, polos, entre otras prendas; de esta manera tendrá su negocio abastecido, así espera poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano dese utilizar para poder adquirir un puesto de ventas en el mercado de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Flor is a 25 year old woman. She lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district, with her beloved husband and her little son. He is her main reason for getting ahead. She is a very friendly, entusiastic and hardworking person. Lamentably, due to the necessity of working and paying expenses, she was unable to study and earn a professional degree, but she would have really liked to do it. In her free time, she likes to spend pleasant moments with her family. 

With much hard work and dedication, day to day Flor works in her little clothes selling business. From the very early hours in the morning she goes to the market in her town to sell as a street vendor. She works approximately 10 hours a day and at night she goes to her district stadium where she sells candies and snacks. She likes doing her job and she believes that it is going well for her because of her hard work and the friendly way she treats other people.

Flor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thank to the help that has been offered she can buy merchandise such as: jackets, sweaters, pants, t-shirts and more. This way, her business will be stocked. She hopes she can increase her sales and her financial income, which in the not so distant future she wants to use to acquire a sales point in her city's market.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: jackets, pants, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a hardworking business lady and married. She operates a pharmacy to earn a living. She has been in this business for one year. Besides this, she depends on her husband's salary. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya she has improved her saving skills because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Beatrice has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Gladys Nelly
