She hopes to grow her cash crops in a timely manner in order to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and gasoline for a water pump.

loans.name: Adewale

texts.fr: Adewale est un jeune vendeur de compléments alimentaires âgé 23 ans. Il a démarré l'année dernière son activité. Adewale a besoin d'augmenter son stock pour faire évoluer son activité. C'est dans ce but qu'il engage un crédit auprès de notre institution. Adewale souhaite épargner les profits qu'il fera dans le but d'ouvrir dans un avenir proche d'autres succursales à sa boutique. Il espère également gagner un revenu capable d'entretenir sa future famille.
texts.en: Adewale, aged 23, is a young seller of dietary supplements. He started this business last year. He needs to increase his inventory to operate his business. With this goal, he is taking on a loan from our institution. Adewale would like to save the profits he makes with the aim of opening a chain of stores in the near future. He also hopes to earn the revenues able to support his future family.

loans.use: to buy dietary supplements

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 47 years old and a mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her. She earns her daily income by growing paddy rice on two hectares of farmland. She has been involved in this business for 20 years and is able to earn about 26,000 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan cycle for Mom with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The loans, which she has successfully paid back, have sustained her current business especially in paying for plowing fees. Now she leads a group of two to request a new loan:  Her group member is a newly joined client. She and her group member are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. Mom will use part of her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and another part of it to pay a plowing fee for her rice field. She expects to earn more income and maintain the standard of living for her household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee for her rice field

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and the mother of six children, some of whom are enrolled in school. She earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables at a local market. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She also earns additional income by selling water. She works six days a week, and is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more watermelons, pineapples, passion fruits, onions and tomatoes to sell. Her major business challenges are transportation costs and the seasonality of various crops. Her goals and aspirations are to build her own house and to educate her children to the university level. She lives in a rented house and her family has no access to piped-in water or electricity.  Her major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 32 years old, is married and has two children. For the past two years, she has operated a tailoring business and has one employee. Her business environment is competitive but she has reliable customers. She testifies that Faulu Kenya has helped her expand her business through the trainings she attended and the loans she acquired. Susan dreams of increasing her clientele in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. For the past 8 years, Florita has provided motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline. Florita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline

loans.name: Delfina Maria

texts.es: Delfina de 38 años de edad vive al Sur Occidente de la ciudad, con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 10 a 16 años. Ella en el año 2002 inició su idea de negocio, pues observó la oportunidad de emprenderlo en la necesidad de  sus vecinos por responder a  sus requerimientos de comunicación.  Ella  inició con una línea de celulares para todas los operadores, poco a poco creció su negocio y  Hoy cuenta con 14 equipos y líneas de diferentes operadores, vende recargas y accesorios para celulares. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará celulares y accesorios para ofrecerlos a la venta, pues son productos de muy buena salida comercial y que rotan rápidamente, así mismo planea con su credikiva comprar recargas para la venta.  Su meta es ampliar su negocio y diversificarlo agregando mercancías de misceláneas,  hasta lograr tener su almacén, donde su clientela encuentre todo lo que necesita y a ellos le ahorre gastos de transporte y/o esfuerzos mayores, por no encontrar lo que necesitan al alcance de su mano. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 15%, que planea poco a poco hacerla crecer, mediante compras a un mayor volumen y ventas que roten rápidamente, para ganar un poco más. Esta es la razón por la cual cree firmemente en que su credikiva logrará ampliar su capital y adquirir productos muy comerciales en el sector al cual dirige su acción comercial.
texts.en: 38-year-old Delfina lives in the southwest area of the town with her husband and her four children aged 10 to 16. She started her business idea in 2002, because she saw a business opportunity in the need that her neighbors had to respond to their communication requests. She first started with a line of cell phones for every phone operator, and gradually her business grew. She currently has 14 computers and lines of various operators, and she sells cell phone recharges and accessories. She's currently applying for her first Kiva loan, which she'll use to purchase cell phones and accessories for selling, because they're products that sell very well and change rapidly. She'll also use her Kiva loan to purchase recharges for selling. Her goal is to exand and diversify her business by adding miscellaneous merchandise until she succeeds in having her own grocery store, where her customers can find everything they need. That way they'll save themselves the transportation money and the extra effort for not finding everything within their reach. Meanwhile, she maintains a sales profit of no less than 15%, and she plans to gradually increase it by buying in bulk and selling fast-changing products, so that she earns a bit more. That is the reason why she firmly believes that with her Kiva loan she'll successfully increase her capital and buy products that are very high-selling in her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 24 years old and married, with one child. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He runs his business in a competitive environment with readily available customers. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has developed his business because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of owning a Nissan in the future. George needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Defe-Defe Group

texts.fr: Agé de 49ans, père de 4 enfants dont 02 sur les bans d’école, Mr Nassame, cultivateur de profession est marié à une revendeuse. Il cultive du mais, du riz, du piment, dans sa ferme et est aidé par 02 personnes. Afin d’acheter des intrants agricoles, il sollicite un quatrième prêt dans notre institution. Il désire augmenter sa superficie cultivable et assurer le bien être de la famille. Il a été nommé pour être le responsable de leur groupement « DEFE-DEFE ». Tous sont dans cette activité il y a un bon moment et ils sont dans la culture du piment, du riz, du mais et autres. Ils espèrent assurer un avenir radieux à leurs familles.
texts.en:
A 49-year-old father of four children, of whom two are in school, Mr. Nassame, a farmer by trade, is married to a retailer. He grows corn, rice, and chili peppers on his farm. He has two persons to help him. 

To purchase farm inputs, he is requesting a fourth loan from our institution. He would like to extend his arable land and ensure his family's well-being. 

He has been named as the official of their group "DEFE-DEFE". All of them have been in this business for quite a while now, and they grow chili peppers, rice, corn, and more. They hope to ensure a bright future for their families.

loans.use: to buy work tools (farm inputs)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa a 42 ans, elle vit à Lomé avec son mari et ses deux enfants de 12 et 18 ans qui sont tous les deux scolarisés. Le mari de Yawa est, comme elle, revendeur sur les marchés. Yawa vend de manière ambulante des pagnes et des assiettes. Afin de faire évoluer son activité elle a besoin d'avoir plus de stock. C'est dans ce but qu'elle sollicite un prêt chez Wages. Elle compte réinvestir ses profits futurs dans l'activité. Yawa a pour projet d'ouvrir une grande boutique de vente de pagne afin d'assurer les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Yawa is 42 years old and lives in Lomé with  her husband. She has two children, 12 and 18 years old, who are both in school. Her husband is, like her, a retailer at the markets. Yawa sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and plates door to door. To operate her business, she needs more inventory. With this goal, she is requesting a loan from WAGES. She intends to reinvest the future profits into her business. Yawa has plans to open a large shop selling 'pagne' cloth to ensure her family's needs are met.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth and plates

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr: Pascal a 40 ans, il est marié et a trois enfants de 3, 6 et 9 ans. Les deux plus âgés sont aujourd'hui scolarisés. L'épouse de Pascal est couturière. Pascal exerce depuis 16 ans la profession de tailleur. Pascal a besoin de machines supplémentaires pour développer son activité et satisfaire les clients sur tous les plans. C'est pour cela, il sollicite un crédit dans notre institution. Il désire acheter une machine à coudre et une machine de surfilage. Pascal réinjectera les profits réalisés dans son entreprise. Il espère avoir un jour posséder d'autre atelier et assurer à sa famille un bon niveau de vie.
texts.en: Pascal is 40 years old and married, and he has three children, aged 3, 6, and 9 years old. The two oldest are in school now. His spouse is a seamstress. Pascal has been working as a tailor by trade for sixteen years. He needs extra machines for developing his business and satisfying his customers overall. For these reasons, he is requesting a loan from our institution. He would like to buy a sewing machine and an overcasting machine. Pascal will reinvest the profits made from his enterprise. He hopes to own another workshop one day and ensure a good quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overcasting machine

loans.name: Bai's Group

texts.en:
Bai, aged 34, is a married woman residing in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang district, Cambodia. She has six children, one daughter and five sons, all of whom are still in school. To support this big household, she and her husband have been planting paddy rice for 10 years, and supplement their income via selling porridge in the village. Her main challenge is the low crop yield caused by the flood. 

Bai's group consists of two female members; this is the fifth loan cycle for both of them. With success, the past loans have been repaid and have helped Bai to grow her rice in a timely manner and keep all of her children in school. 

Bai and her group member are seeking a new loan of 400,000 KHR and 700,000 KHR, respectively. Bai is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes to receive more yield to make more income so that she can expand her current business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 23 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Rosalie is buying and selling green bananas. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more green bananas to re-sell.

Rosalie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas to re-sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 46 years old. He is married to Emily, and together they have three children aged 20, 17 and 14 years.

He has been in the business of selling fruits for 23 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 (Kenyan shillings).

The loan will be used to buy more fruits like pineapples and bananas. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the first loan. His hopes and dreams are to be a fruit wholesaler/distributor and also engage in farming.

loans.use: to buy fruits like bananas and pineapples.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is 49 years old and lives in the town of Najera in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 19 years, she has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells paper-packing materials. 

To help expand her business, Proscovia has requested a loan for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more paper materials to sell to supermarkets, hotels and other companies. This will help her to generate greater profits and boost her income and improve her family status. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a wholesale business and open other related businesses. 

Proscovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Proscovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more paper materials to sell to supermarkets, hotels and other companies.

loans.name: Njuguna

texts.en: Njuguna is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He also sells clothes to generate more income. He has been engaged in this business for ten years and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his saving skills because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 55,000 KES to buy maize flour, cooking oil, sugar and clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil, sugar and clothes.

loans.name: Lezenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lezenia, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada tiene dos hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.
Ella hace 9 años que se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo, donde cultiva maíz, frijoles y hortalizas. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento a los cultivos de maíz, frijoles y hortalizas. Este préstamo es el sexto que solicita, y le han ayudado a mantener estables sus cultivos y quiere seguir con la asistencia y mejorar cada día las tierras para hacerlas más productivas y sacar buenas cosechas. Su meta es adquirir más terreno para sembrar y dejarles patrimonio de trabajo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lezenia, 37, is married and has 2 children.  She lives with her family in the town of Nueva Frontera in the department of Santa Barbara.

She has been farming for 9 years along with her husband.  They cultivate corn, beans and vegetables, and they sell their produce in the local market.

Lezenia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers so that she can maintain her corn, bean and vegetable crops.  This is the 6th loan that she has requested, and the previous loans have helped her to keep her crops stable.  She wants to continue with this assistance so that she can improve her land over time and make it more productive.  This way she will get good harvests.  Lezenia's goal is to acquire more land to cultivate and eventually leave to her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her corn, bean and vegetable crops

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 1 child. 

Dionesio is providing cab services. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

Dionesio has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Dionesio hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Juan Isidro

texts.es:
Juan Isidro, tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Don Juan Isidro tiene aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, el cultiva café, maíz y frijoles. Tiene mucha experiencia en agricultura y tiene sus propias tierras. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para fertilizar la finca de café y cultivar maíz y frijoles. Su objetivo es mantener las tierras en buen estado para que sus cosechas sean mejores y obtener más ganancias. Su meta es seguir obteniendo tierras para ampliar el cultivo de café y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Juan Isidro, 58, lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera in the department of Santa Barbara with his wife and their two children.

Juan Isidro has been a farmer for about 30 years; he cultivates coffee, corn and beans.  He has a lot of experience in agriculture, and he has his own lands.  He sells his produce in the local market.  He is requesting a loan for 15,000 Honduran lempiras to fertilize his coffee farm and his corn and bean crops.  His goal is to maintain his land in good condition so that his harvests will be better and he will get higher earnings.  He wants to continue to buy land so that he can expand his coffee farm and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee farm and his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en:
Nov, 26, is a mother of two dependent children, one daughter and one son. The family is currently living in Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To tackle the family's difficulties, she farms two hectares of farmland, on which she grows paddy. Her husband not only has helped her in the rice field but also works for others for pay during his spare for the extra income. She has engaged in this business for five years and it earns her about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Nov's group consists of two female members and she is the group leader. She and her group member are on their second loan cycle and first loan cycle, respectively, with VisionFund. The first loan which she completely paid back has upgraded her standard of living steadily. Now, Nov is applying for 300,000 KHR while her co-member is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. For Nov, her loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer and gasoline for pumping water. Moreover, she will use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes to gain more yield so as to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for  pumping water

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia  is  40  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Lucia  has a sari-sari (general) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 7  years. She requested a loan for  PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lucia  joined in 2012. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business to benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mehry

texts.en:
Mehry is married and has 2 children who are 19 and 12 years old. Her husband is a driver. She always wanted to provide her children with a good education.  Because her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Mehry decided to start a new business,  sewing national dresses in order to generate an income that she can contribute to her home’s finances. If you will help her with money she will buy a sewing machine. 

Mehry studied a course in "To get a success" at a women's organization and learned business skills.  She will be a  very successful businesswoman as she is hard-working and smart. She is asking for a loan of 7000 TJS to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She will get through, using a loan, and her business will be a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities in the future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have the refurbishment, general maintenance, and the purchase of tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Bonverture

texts.en:
Bonverture is 50 years old and married, with seven children who are in school. He sells shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for fourteen years and has employed one person. He also does farming to supplement his income. 

He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to improve his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Chaan's Group

texts.en:
Chaan,  a 52-year-old mother, is one of the breadwinners of her family. She needs to care for her two dependent children as they are still in school. She and her husband have been farming for 5 years to support the entire family.  This business earns them about 15,000 KHR per day. From this dual income, they are able to save about KHR 4,000 per day. 

Chaan, along with two other members, has just joined VisionFund this cycle to seek a new loan. Chaan and one other member are seeking 200,000 KHR each while the remaining member is requesting 300,000 KHR. As the group leader, Chaan will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make a good progress with her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Kustiyah

texts.en:
Kustiyah opened a shop at home to help increase the income for her family's daily needs, but their income is still far from enough. Her husband died five years ago. Now Kustiyah is the backbone of her family and lives with her four children. With the Student Loan program from Kiva, Kustiyah looks forward to helping Jaenul finish school at Vocational School
.
Jaenul is the youngest of four siblings. Jaenul's sister could not continue her studies. She quit after graduating from junior high school because of funding problems. Jaenul really wants to learn and believes that he can help his mother so much better after getting a higher education. In the picture are Jaenul and Kustiyah, his mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children who all go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (two orphans). She sells firewood and charcoal stoves at the market and from home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. 

Fatuma works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy firewood and charcoal stoves. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to   buy a plot of land and build her own house. She lives in a rented house and family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water.  Her major expenses include rent and medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and charcoal stoves

loans.name: Sahro

texts.en:
Sahro works as a seasonal worker with an uncertain income. His wife does not work, so the family's income is minimal. Sahro has to pay for his children to go to school, because Sahro does not want his children to suffer the same fate as him. Sahro hopes, with the Kiva Student Loan program, he can help his children complete their schooling.

Qodar, his son, lives in a village far from the city. Qodar has two siblings. He realizes that his parents are getting older. Qodar wants to pursue a vocational education in school so he can get a good job after graduation and eventually really help families. In the picture are Qodar and Sahro, his father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Sugeng

texts.en:
Sugeng works as a laborer in a lumber mill not far from his home. His wife does not have any special skills to get a job so she cannot help much. Their economic situation is minimal and Sugeng fears for the future of their children. He is compelled to follow Kiva's student loan program to pay for Nanda's school fees to complete her studies.

Nanda really wants to help her parents, but Nanda realizes there is nothing she can do with only a junior certificate. That's why Nanda wants to continue studying at a vocational school, so she can get a better job to help them after graduation. In the picture, Nanda is shown with Sugeng, her father.

loans.use: To pay education fee at a vocational school

loans.name: Gondo

texts.en:
Gondo is a laborer on a farm with an uncertain income. His wife helps Gondo as an agricultural laborer. Gondo and his wife's income is only sufficient to meet basic daily needs, so Gondo had problems with his children's school fees. Gondo hopes that the Kiva Student Loan program can help pay for school fees for Ruri.

Ruri is the second of four brothers. Ruri does not have a job and still is in the care of older people. Meanwhile, his brothers are getting bigger and their parents should think about their education. Ruri is very grateful for the presence of the Kiva Student Loan program. With this loan, he can finish school. In the picture, Ruri appears with Gondo, his father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr:
Les besoins liées à son véhicule, Mor, un chauffeur de 40 ans, qui a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans ce métier ; vient solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC  pour renouveler un crédit  à hauteur de 50000F CFA afin de pouvoir repeindre son véhicule.
Monsieur Mor est marié et père de famille. Il gère sa petite famille avec les recettes de son activité.
Il envisage  d’acheter un autre véhicule pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mor, a 40-year-old driver, has more than 15 years of experience in his job, and his needs are tied to his vehicle. He has just sought support from IMCEC to renew a loan amounting to 50,000 FCFA in order to be able to repaint his vehicle.
Mr. Mor is married and the father of a family. He manages his small family with the income from his business.
He foresees buying another vehicle to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy paint to repaint his taxi.

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang works as a domestic servant with only enough income for their daily living. Endang is the grandmother of Silvia. Silvia is currently attending vocational school. Silvia's father does not have a specific job but her mother works in the city to help the family. Endang is applying for a loan to help pay for the education of Silvia.

Silvia hopes that this loan will alleviate the burden of thinking of her grandmother and her parents. Silvia can focus and keep her spirit up to continue her studies, because she does not have to worry that the study will be disrupted because of the cost. And ideals can be realized as a professional accountant. In the picture are Silvia and Endang, her grandmother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 23 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.  Ginalyn has a sari-sari (general) store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ginalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ginalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady  est la technicienne de surface d’un de nos guichets. Elle est aussi une habituée de l’IMCEC, car en dehors de son métier, elle fait du commerce de divers. Seulement pour cette fois ci, elle sollicite un crédit de 50000F FCFA pour régler des problèmes sociaux.
Khady est mariée et avec ses revenus, appui sa famille dans les besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Khady is the cleaner at one of our branches. She is also a regular at IMCEC, since she runs a business selling various items outside of her main job. Just for this one time, she is seeking a loan of 50,000 FCFA to settle some social issues.
Khady is married and supports her family's daily needs with her income.

loans.use: To settle a social need.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une dame de 52 ans qui s’active dans le petit commerce depuis plus de 15 ans maintenant. Elle est divorcée  et vit avec son frère qui se trouve être en France .Elle fait de la vente de produits alimentaires tels que : de l’huile de palme, de l’eau de citron, du poisson fumé et séché…
Fatou est divorcée et se gère elle même.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou is a 52-year-old woman who has been involved in her own small business for over 15 years now. She is divorced and lives with her brother, who is currently in France. She sells food items such as palm oil, lemon water, smoked and dried fish, etc.
Fatou is divorced and provides for herself.

loans.use: To buy various food items for resale (palm oil, lemon water, dried and smoked fish)

loans.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr:
Madame Dieumbe, agée de 36 ans possède un restaurant fast Food près de là  ou elle loge ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis  plus de 5 ans déjà. Elle n’est pas une novice dans le crédit car elle a eu à faire parti d’un groupement de femme. Maintenant que ses affaires vont plus régulières, elle est sorti du groupement  pour pouvoir bénéficier d’un montant supérieur que d’habitude. C e crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de se ravitailler en denrées alimentaires (viande, huile, pomme de terre et autres ingrédients qui entrent dans la cuisson. 
Elle gère ses propres besoins et appui son époux dans la dépense quotidienne.
Elle désire agrandir davantage  son exploitation avec l’aide d’une Institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Ms. Dieumbe is 36 years old and owns a fast food restaurant near where she lives; she has run this business for more than five years already. She is not new to microfinance, as she used to belong to a women's loan group. Now that her business is running more regularly, she has left the group in order to be able to benefit from a larger loan amount than previously. The loan she is seeking will allow her to restock her business with foodstuffs (meat, oil, potatoes, and other ingredients used in cooking).
She provides for herself and supports her husband with the daily expenses.
She wants to further expand her business with the help of a financial institution like IMCEC.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her restaurant (oil, meat, potatoes, ingredients)

loans.name: Magaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Magaye est un tailleur qui possède son propre atelier depuis 2000. Il est  marié et père de famille. Il possède des machines à coudre et veut augmenter son parc avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Et veut dans l’avenir élargir son activité à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
Mr. Magaye is a tailor who has owned his own workshop since 2000. He is married and is the father of a family.  He owns some sewing machines and wants to increase his stock with the loan he is seeking.
He takes care of his family's daily expenses.
In the future, he wants to expand his business and bring it to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for his work.

loans.name: Juharti

texts.en:
Juharti opened a shop at home to help improve her family's economy. Her husband is a laborer whose income is uncertain and depends on the presence or absence of work. Juharti is very concerned about the future of their children, especially their education.Juharti requested a loan from Kiva in order to finance their children's schooling.

Sofyan is the third child in the family. His two older brothers are married but they still do not own their own homes. Sofyan really wants to keep learning, because he wants to have a bright future and become a professional accountant. In the picture, Sofyan appears with Juharti, his mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Doña Olga, tiene 55 años de edad, reside en el municipio de nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La señora tiene 10 años de haber establecido el negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, pan, manteca, frijoles, abarrotes, harina, refrescos, lácteos, etc. para mantener estable su negocio quiere invertir otro préstamo, para eso solicita este préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras para mantener siempre surtido y variedad de productos alimenticios que demandan sus clientes. Su meta es tener un local en un buen lugar y con buena clientela.
texts.en:
Olga is 55, and lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara department, with her husband and their three children. 

She set up her small grocery store ten years ago, and sells basic household products, such as rice, bread, lard, beans, groceries, flour, soft drinks, dairy products, etc. 

In order to keep her business stable, she wants to invest another loan. That is why she is applying for this loan of 5,000 lempiras, in order to always stay supplied with a variety of food products that her customers ask for. 

Her goal is to have a shop in a good location with a good clientele.

loans.use: To buy goods such as dairy products, soft drinks, bread, sugar, flour, lard, etc., for supplying her store.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is 51 years old and married. He sells food items to earn a living. He has his own shop and sells high-quality food items such as bread, butter and conserves (jams) for his customers. He has been in the business for four years. 

Through financial support from his brothers, he has managed to grow his business. He has additional income from selling dried fruits. One time a month he exports his goods to Russia. His brothers and his wife help him with business. 

He dreams of expanding his business and becoming prosperous in the future. He needs a loan of $1,500 to buy food items for widening the assortment of goods to sell. He will look forward to your help.

loans.use: To buy food products for widening the assortment of goods to sell.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is 57 years old, married with three children and lives in the Philippines. Claudia  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for  6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Claudia has been a member of HSPFI since 1998. In the future, Claudia hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sartono

texts.en:
Sartono gets seasonal employment with an uncertain income and the work is uncertain. His wife opened a shop at home to help the economic situation of the family. However, the results are still far from enough. Sartono has four children, Soimah is the last child and hopes to stay in school. Sartono applied  for a loan through Kiva's Student Loan program  to help Soimah complete her studies at a vocational school.

Soimah has three siblings and she is eager to continue her education at a vocational school. Soimah wants to make her parents happy and achieve her goal of being a designer of clothes. With a loan from Kiva, this is now certain. In the picture are Soimah and Sartono, her father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational  school

loans.name: Salimin

texts.en:
Salimin is a maker of bricks with a daily income of less than 30 USD. In the rainy season, there is no income because Salimin can not make bricks. With a situation like this, it is clearly difficult to finance all four of his children's school expenses.  Finally, Salimin applied for a loan through Kiva's Student Loan program. He hopes to help Wiwin, his daughter, finish school at the vocational school.

Wiwin is number two of four siblings. Her goal is to become a designer of dresses. With a loan from Kiva, she hopes to finish school and help her parents and younger siblings. In the picture, Wiwin appears with Salimin, her father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Kamisem

texts.en:
Kamisem works as a casual laborer. Her income is very minimal. If one day Kamisem does not work, then that day she does not get money. If Kamisem is experiencing pain, then she cannot get income. With these conditions, Kamisem is greatly saddened about the education of their children. Therefore, Kamisem is applying for a loan through Kiva's student loan program, in order to allow Sulastri to finish school.

Sulastri lives in a hilly, dry area with damaged roads and houses that are quite a distance away from the school. She attends a vocational school. She aspires to be a computer expert. Sulastri has a four-year-old brother. She hopes, through the help of the Kiva student loan program, to help ease the burden on her mother. In the picture, Sulastri and Kamisem her mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Jamiyah

texts.en:
Farm labor is Jamiyah's job. She's the mother of one student, Syaefudin, at the vocational school. Her earnings as a laborer are not enough to cover all the needs of her family. Jamiyah and Syaefudin have concerns about the son's education. Jamiyah hopes to follow the student loan program, to fund Syaefudin's studies so he can finish school.

Syaefudin aspires to be a computer programmer. He still wants to attend the vocational school. He is hoping the Kiva student loan program can help him to finish school so he can quickly get a job and help his family. In the picture, Syaefudin and Jamiyah his mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en: Sivorn, 33, is a mother of two sons who currently are working at a local organization in the community. She has been involved in producing rice wine as her major source of income. She also raises pigs and sells hashed roll meat wrapped in banana leaves (the most popular dessert in Battambang for Cambodians) for extra income. Sivorn's group consists of two female members; she is the group leader and she is a first-time borrower with VisionFund while the other member is a sixth-time borrower. She and her partner are seeking a new loan of  500,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy materials for producing her rice wine, including yeast and rice. She expects to make more income so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing her rice wine.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is a 48-year-old, hard-working housewife with three sons and three daughters and is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past five years, her husband has been driving a van, which is the only source of income for his family.

Rabia is a member of three-person lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's transportation business by buying a new van. This will not only help expand their transportation business but will also help increase their monthly income. She is very hopeful that the loan will be productive so that they can meet the basic necessities of their family and provide education to their children.

loans.use: to buy a new van for her husband's transportation business.
